Resolved Jamimpi.name: Resolved Jamimpi
Resolved Jamimpi.description:
The opposite of dark nagas in many ways, guardian nagas are benevolent and wise protectors of places of great natural or supernatural significance: ancient oak groves, forgotten holy temples, and vaults of sacred power are just a few examples of locations that these nagas protect. Guardian nagas believe that the beautiful elements of the cosmos are worthy of protection and that devotion to such a grand effort is its own reward. A guardian naga may join a group with similar values, such as a sect of priests or monks, to aid it in its holy endeavors and to exchange knowledge of the heavens.

Guardian nagas usually encourage their young, upon reaching adulthood, to depart the nest and seek out their own natural wonders or ancient ruins to protect. Sometimes generations of guardian nagas might guard the same place, passing the honor of such care from parent to child. In such cases, the parent nagas aim to have at least one of their children elect to stay behind and become the guardian of their ancestral ward, giving the parents the peace of mind that the site they protect will continue to be guarded by their descendants.

It is difficult for many societies that vilify serpents or see them as symbols of evil to accept the fact that guardian nagas are benevolent and kindly. Fortunately for these people, guardian nagas are also patient and understanding, and see encounters with such societies as opportunities to educate and expand worldviews.

Nagas are serpentine beings with magical powers and keen, nearly inscrutable intellects. Physically, they resemble massive snakes with eerie visages that resemble those of humans. Nagas use their innate magic and poisonous fangs to keep all but the most stalwart foes at bay. Beyond the natural weapons they use to ward away foes, little is understood of the naga's unsettling physiology.

Nagas are intelligent creatures with powerful needs to pursue, be they the accumulation of knowledge, the collection of rare art, or the rule of an entire nation. On Golarion, the nation of Nagajor is one such society-an entire empire ruled by nagas and populated by reptilian humanoids who serve their naga rulers with a patriotic pride that borders on worship.

Still, most adventurers interact with nagas on a much smaller scale, encountering them as dangerous guardians in remote locations or not-so-abandoned ruins. In many cases, these nagas have heard of distant Nagajor, but they are usually unwilling to abandon their own pursuits to seek out a land where they might be worshipped as gods.

sTnyQQeOWiyHDhNt.name: Guardian Naga Venom
sTnyQQeOWiyHDhNt.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:33]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Sezelrian Warg.name: Sezelrian Warg
Sezelrian Warg.description:
Winter wolves are related to wargs, but are larger, smarter, and far more dangerous. They are capable of exhaling plumes of freezing breath and are big enough to easily serve as mounts for orcs and hobgoblins-provided the winter wolf is willing, of course. Like wargs, winter wolves hunt in packs, but unlike their smaller cousins, they have a notable proud streak. When they deign to serve others, they reserve this privilege for larger and more dangerous creatures such as frost giants, renegade yetis, or even white dragons.

The warg is an intelligent and malevolent wolf that dwells among goblins, hobgoblins, orcs, and other violent humanoids.

HFyEFMKsCld64B15.name: Avenging Bite
HFyEFMKsCld64B15.description:
Trigger A creature within the reach of the Sezelrian warg's jaws attacks one of the warg's allies

Effect The Sezelrian warg makes a jaws Strike against the triggering creature.

dPsbBLbGfNPn6v9L.name: Breath Weapon
dPsbBLbGfNPn6v9L.description: The Sezelrian warg breathes a cloud of smoky fire in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[5d8[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic|options:area-effect] save). The Sezelrian warg cannot use Breath Weapon for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

9RRqDOZEOM8rUI1P.name: Pack Attack
9RRqDOZEOM8rUI1P.description: The Sezelrian warg's Strikes deal 1d6 extra damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of the warg's allies.

IHLllwlUCgomc8hX.name: Flee
IHLllwlUCgomc8hX.description:
Trigger The hermit rat's jar is destroyed

Effect The hermit rat Strides up to its Speed without triggering reactions.

7YWR4XkTyAFRJ184.name: Kimchi Jar Shell
7YWR4XkTyAFRJ184.description: The hermit rat's kimchi jar shell has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once hermit rat is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its kimchi jar shell breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 13

Hn4ER7lWs29tdyTk.name: Ram
Hn4ER7lWs29tdyTk.description: The hermit rat rolls in its vessel up to its full movement, ramming into a target in its path and dealing @Damage[(1d6+2)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save).

Dull Pukwudgie.name: Dull Pukwudgie
Dull Pukwudgie.description:
Pukwudgies go by many names in many regions, but those who know of them agree that defying their mischievous nature provokes their wrath.

In ancient times, pukwudgies traveled to the Material Plane from the First World, perhaps in the wake of the gnome emigration. These proud fey are obsessed with displays of respect, and while they first attempted to befriend mortals, each attempt ended in tragedy as the pukwudgies perceived any potential slight as a grave insult. Mortals, fearing these reactions, began to view pukwudgies as nuisances, and pukwudgies in turn began to resent mortals and the gods that favored them. At their best, pukwudgies play cruel jokes on mortals they encounter. At their worst, they've been known to kidnap and even kill those who don't treat them with proper respect.

Pukwudgies make their villages in the oldest forests, concealed under @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage} spells and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.nA0XlPsnMNrQMpio]{Fantastic Facade} rituals. They travel freely between the Material Plane and the First World through tiny portals beneath hills, trees, or stones. No strangers to violence, pukwudgies rarely travel alone and often anoint their quills or weapons with a custom-brewed poison before entering hostile situations.

Standing about 2 feet tall, a pukwudgie sports sharp quills growing from their head that extends down their back. Their skin tone varies by the region in which they live, ranging from pale gray to brown.

JQcN49zNIu4wTuSg.name: Defensive Quills
JQcN49zNIu4wTuSg.description:
A creature that hits a pukwudgie with an unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee Strike takes @Damage[3d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save). On a critical failure, the creature also takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,poison]] from the poisoned quills.

Note: A DC was not provided for this ability by Paizo. The DC present here is a moderate DC for the creature level according to the Gamemastery Guide creature building Tables

e81mjeZGp9mKBDKv.name: Change Shape
e81mjeZGp9mKBDKv.description:
The pukwudgie takes on the physical form of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-3.Actor.IijUBFE1vhvgowhD]{Giant Porcupine}. Their size changes to Medium, they lose their weapon Strikes, and they gain a quill Strike (+16 for 2d8+4 piercing plus 1d8 persistent poison).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

lV8lCapoUOFDMPz8.name: Pukwudgie Poison
lV8lCapoUOFDMPz8.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:23]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, and stupefied 2 (1 round)

HRXrzDHINgA2Nqf9.name: Combat Pickpocket
HRXrzDHINgA2Nqf9.description:
Requirements The robber novice is in the same square or adjacent to the target

Effect The robber novice can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} an object they can see on the target using their Thievery modifier against the target's Perception DC.

I5hUXCEAx9YUdyA0.name: Hidden Movement
I5hUXCEAx9YUdyA0.description: If the assassins' guild rogue starts its turn undetected by a creature or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from it, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the rogue's attacks until the end of the rogue's turn.

loEYWNHauhzET7yP.name: Sneak Attack
loEYWNHauhzET7yP.description: The assassins' guild rogue deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

AQV3xwBG3qhhy7JJ.name: Swarming Bites
AQV3xwBG3qhhy7JJ.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[1d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save).

Spry Blodeuwedd.name: Spry Blodeuwedd
Spry Blodeuwedd.description:
The mysterious blodeuwedds dwell in those parts of the world where the boundaries between the Material Plane and the First World have worn thin, or around portals between the two planes. Their link with such regions of the natural world is so strong that it rivals the bond shared between nymphs and places of great natural beauty, yet none would look upon a blodeuwedd and mistake them for something as elegant as a nymph.

Although blodeuwedds share certain traits with nymphs, their role as guardians of the pathways between this world and the First World prevents them from forming as powerful a magical bond with the natural world. Never truly a part of either reality yet forced to keep watch over both, blodeuwedds tend to grow cynical and sharp-tongued toward any who would seek travel from one realm to the other, regardless of their actual goals.

5t9D4gKM7JVpBSf6.name: Wild Empathy
5t9D4gKM7JVpBSf6.description: The blodeuwedd can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on and make very simple @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Requests} of animals.

8RH2spsc79xmzAXn.name: Allergen Aura
8RH2spsc79xmzAXn.description: A blodeuwedd exudes a 30-foot aura of pollen and irritating allergens. A non-plant living creature that begins its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}. A creature that succeeds at its save is then temporarily immune to the allergen aura for 24 hours. A blodeuwedd can suppress this aura or activate it again as a free action.

JtEaK5YV5AgypBAF.name: Change Shape
JtEaK5YV5AgypBAF.description:
A blodeuwedd can take on the appearance of a single unique humanoid or the form of a prairie owl.

When in humanoid form, the blodeuwedd loses its claw attack.

In owl form, its statistics change as follows:

  • Size Small;
  • Speed fly 60 feet;
  • Melee a talons [[/r {1d20+15} #Attack]]{+15}, Damage @Damage[(1d3-1)[slashing]].

A blodeuwedd can return to their normal form as a free action.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

CAKfIK6WRhkgpCW2.name: Living Footsteps
CAKfIK6WRhkgpCW2.description: Every Stride action taken by a blodeuwedd causes small plants, grasses, and wildflowers to sprout from the ground, though they can suppress this effect if they desire. In a region or terrain that wouldn't normally support plant life, these plants thrive for 1 minute before withering away.

VwEyLSgIQwBeoPyV.name: Nature's Infusion
VwEyLSgIQwBeoPyV.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect While surrounded by any field or fertile plain, a blodeuwedd can infuse themself with borrowed life energy from nearby plants and nutrients in the ground. The blodeuwedd gains 15 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 hour.

Alystair Caskwater (3-4).name: Alystair Caskwater (3-4)
Alystair Caskwater (3-4).description:
Risen corpses of sailors who died at sea, draugr reek of the rot and decay of the briny deep. Their eyes glow with ghastly green light, and rotting seaweed, barnacles, and dead sea creatures cling to their bodies. Draugr can't speak, but expresses their malicious emotions with gurgles, as though they were eternally drowning with lungs full of water. They desire little more than to attack living creatures, especially those who sail the sea. Even when they go upon land, draugrs often drag the corpses of those they strike down back to the water, populating the depths with even more dead.

Draugr rise in the haunted places of the sea, where restless spirits, swells of void energy, or supernatural storms deliver death. A corpse might rest at the bottom of the sea for some time before awakening as a draugr. Collecting detritus and organisms, a corpse becomes increasingly disgusting before it finally rises. Proximity to intelligent life can expedite this process, and an underwater explorer who happens upon a shipwreck might cause a body to snap to unlife as a draugr suddenly. The creatures don't take intrusions lightly, especially upon their place of death.

Though steeped in evil, draugr are susceptible to reminders of their lives as mariners. In particular, a well-performed sea shanty or call-and-response work song might cause a draugr to become lost in reverie for a moment. The creatures have even been witnessed moaning along, unable to sing the words but providing haunting accompaniment. The lull rarely lasts long, though, as the beauty of the song quickly becomes a reminder of the tragedy that befell the draugr, reaffirming their desire for blood and death.

More powerful draugr with burning red eyes are called draugr captains. They're 3rd-level creatures with elite adjustments that can cast obscuring mist as an innate divine spell three times per day.

Qs8JZrELvc5vMsxP.name: The Void's Revenge
Qs8JZrELvc5vMsxP.description: A creature that slays Alystair is subjected to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{Mariner's Curse} spell with a @Check[will|dc:20|traits:spell] save. The curse ends if the draugr is buried in a calm sea or after 1 week passes.

cjYLiElA3muRcJuo.name: Grotesque Gift
cjYLiElA3muRcJuo.description: Alystair's attacks spatter their targets with rancid flesh and rotting seaweed. A creature damaged by a draugr's Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

bS27ihuZ0Xs3mU7a.name: Swipe
bS27ihuZ0Xs3mU7a.description: Alystair Caskwater makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within its melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A Swipe counts as two attacks for the draugr's multiple attack penalty.

0RmPDouTiTcX23fZ.name: Shoulder Check
0RmPDouTiTcX23fZ.description: The angry foolhardy mercenary strides up to their speed and makes an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} one adjacent target at the end of their stride.

Sharp Pukwudgie.name: Sharp Pukwudgie
Sharp Pukwudgie.description:
Pukwudgies go by many names in many regions, but those who know of them agree that defying their mischievous nature provokes their wrath.

In ancient times, pukwudgies traveled to the Material Plane from the First World, perhaps in the wake of the gnome emigration. These proud fey are obsessed with displays of respect, and while they first attempted to befriend mortals, each attempt ended in tragedy as the pukwudgies perceived any potential slight as a grave insult. Mortals, fearing these reactions, began to view pukwudgies as nuisances, and pukwudgies in turn began to resent mortals and the gods that favored them. At their best, pukwudgies play cruel jokes on mortals they encounter. At their worst, they've been known to kidnap and even kill those who don't treat them with proper respect.

Pukwudgies make their villages in the oldest forests, concealed under @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage} spells and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.nA0XlPsnMNrQMpio]{Fantastic Facade} rituals. They travel freely between the Material Plane and the First World through tiny portals beneath hills, trees, or stones. No strangers to violence, pukwudgies rarely travel alone and often anoint their quills or weapons with a custom-brewed poison before entering hostile situations.

Standing about 2 feet tall, a pukwudgie sports sharp quills growing from their head that extends down their back. Their skin tone varies by the region in which they live, ranging from pale gray to brown.

JQcN49zNIu4wTuSg.name: Defensive Quills
JQcN49zNIu4wTuSg.description:
A creature that hits a pukwudgie with an unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee Strike takes @Damage[3d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic] save). On a critical failure, the creature also takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,poison]] from the poisoned quills.

Note: A DC was not provided for this ability by Paizo. The DC present here is a moderate DC for the creature level according to the Gamemastery Guide creature building Tables

e81mjeZGp9mKBDKv.name: Change Shape
e81mjeZGp9mKBDKv.description:
The pukwudgie takes on the physical form of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-3.Actor.IijUBFE1vhvgowhD]{Giant Porcupine}. Their size changes to Medium, they lose their weapon Strikes, and they gain a quill Strike (+20 for 2d8+8 piercing plus 1d8 persistent poison).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

lV8lCapoUOFDMPz8.name: Pukwudgie Poison
lV8lCapoUOFDMPz8.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:27]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, and stupefied 2 (1 round)

Salted Ghost Pirate Captain.name: Salted Ghost Pirate Captain
Salted Ghost Pirate Captain.description:
Undead prowling the ocean on derelict ships have long been threats sailors keep an eye out for. Other than corporeal undead, some undead pirates take on an incorporeal form, especially if their bodies have been lost to the fishes. Captains of crews in particular are likely to return from the dead, perhaps on account of their strong personalities.

Tethered to the world after death by powerful emotions that haven't been resolved, ghosts haunt the living as sad echoes of their former selves.

SeDr8IsuA0cd6pKi.name: Rejuvenation
SeDr8IsuA0cd6pKi.description: When the ghost pirate captain is destroyed, they re-form after [[/br 2d4 #Rejuvenation]]{2d4 days} within the ship or location they're bound to, fully healed. They can be permanently destroyed if their desires are fulfilled, which could involve being defeated in a great battle or ensuring their treasure has been hidden.

oc46s540bthxaecp.name: Combat Current
oc46s540bthxaecp.description: The ghost makes a Strike with its cutlass or hand crossbow, then Flies up to half their Speed and makes a Strike with the other attack. If they moved through an enemy when they Flew, that enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the second Strike.

dz1w9j5ipev8z1v8.name: Savvy Joinin' Me Crew?
dz1w9j5ipev8z1v8.description:
Trigger The ghost reduces a living creature to 0 Hit Points with a melee Strike

Effect The creature attempts a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save. If the creature fails its save, it remains conscious but is controlled by the ghost until it loses its dying condition. It continues to attempt recovery checks as normal for the dying condition. The effect ends if the creature loses the dying condition. If the creature dies while under this effect, it joins the ghost's undead crew in [[/gmr 1d4 #days]]{1d4 days}. If the ghost is destroyed before the creature dies, the creature is spared this terrible fate.

Pampla.name: Pampla
Pampla.description:
Crocodiles can be found basking on riverbanks, lurking in swamps, or floating in lakes. They are usually are indistinguishable from logs when viewed from afar-at least until they attack. Alligators have similar statistics, but because they often live in more temperate climates, they endure cold temperatures better. Unlike alligators, crocodiles can tolerate salt water. Both are formidable predators that are likely to devour careless adventurers who fail to watch where they step.

Powerful and primeval in appearance, crocodiles are dangerous natural predators that dwell in marshes, riverbeds, swamps, and other wetlands.

A0HAbzH4Gjn59ZLw.name: Deep Breath
A0HAbzH4Gjn59ZLw.description: The crocodile can hold its breath for about 2 hours.

WLCM7iPJWfoRusL5.name: Death Roll
WLCM7iPJWfoRusL5.description:
Requirements The crocodile must have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Effect The crocodile tucks its legs and rolls rapidly, twisting its victim. It makes a jaws Strike with a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll against the grabbed creature. If it hits, it also knocks the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If it fails, it releases the creature.

7RWr6kvdyVEcpRTQ.name: Fiery Maw
7RWr6kvdyVEcpRTQ.description: The crocodile lets out a puff of fire in a @Template[cone|distance:15] dealing @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save). It can't use Fiery Maw again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Fiery Maw]]{1d4 rounds}.

Studied Orcish Demonologist.name: Studied Orcish Demonologist
Studied Orcish Demonologist.description:
Demonologists can pull a creature from the Abyss and bend it to their will... for a time.

Those initiated into the hidden truths and forbidden secrets of the world are forever transformed-or so they claim. To the cynical, a mystic is nothing more than a charlatan or zealot. Others profess to sense an aura around such luminaries and treat them with reverence, lest they offend some harbinger of unspeakable doom.

naPxWIBQxbkOgD8M.name: Breach the Abyss
naPxWIBQxbkOgD8M.description:
Requirements The demonologist's last action was to cast a non-cantrip spell

Effect The demonologist siphons energy drawn from the Abyss into their weapon. Until the end of the turn, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 damage.

Roll 1d20 to determine the type:

  • 1-7 acid
  • 8-9 cold
  • 10-11 electricity
  • 12-18 fire
  • 19-20 void

xS8f6u8VDcBepVGM.name: Demon Summoning
xS8f6u8VDcBepVGM.description:
The demonologist can cast a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.29ytKctjg7qSW2ff]{Summon Fiend} arcane spell to summon a demon. To do so, they must sacrifice two 4th-rank prepared spells and voluntarily take @Damage[4d12[mental]] damage that can't be reduced or prevented.

If the demonologist is unable to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3f5DMFu8fPiqHpRg]{Sustain} the Spell, including if they're knocked out or killed, the spell continues, but the GM rolls a @Check[flat|dc:10] each round, ending the spell on a failure.

iGRCXWOQsL9DxC6I.name: Elemental Aura
iGRCXWOQsL9DxC6I.description: Asper surrounds herself with the power of one of the elements under her control (air, fire, or water). If air, she gains resistance 10 to electricity damage and doubles her speed. If fire, she gains resistance 10 to fire damage. Any creature within 30 feet of her who receives fire damage receives an extra @Damage[2d10[persistent,fire]] damage. If water, she gains resistance 10 to cold damage and fast healing 20. This aura persists until she is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, she dismisses the aura, or she releases it via Elemental Burst.

lRmVdj1U5aoLQ0M6.name: Elemental Burst
lRmVdj1U5aoLQ0M6.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Asper releases the elemental aura she currently holds, dealing @Damage[2d8[electricity]] (if air), @Damage[2d8[fire]], or @Damage[2d8[cold]] (if water) damage. She cannot use elemental aura again for that element for 2 rounds.

L57yEsn5SK43H4CF.name: Skittish
L57yEsn5SK43H4CF.description:
Trigger The giant mouse is hit with a melee attack

Effect The giant mouse takes a step after the effects of the triggering attack are resolved.

N3ZqHjUmtow9jTLo.name: Hurried Retreat
N3ZqHjUmtow9jTLo.description:
Requirements The loyalist is adjacent to at least one enemy

Effect The loyalist Strides up to its Speed plus 5 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. It must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.

zjhR3PotkkBXmje6.name: Sneak Attack
zjhR3PotkkBXmje6.description: The loyalist deals an extra 1d4 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

59khVbCdxLuULCtE.name: Leader's Command
59khVbCdxLuULCtE.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The leader orders an ally to attack or to get in position. Until the end of the ally's next turn, they gain the leader's choice of a +2 status bonus to attack rolls or a +10-foot status bonus to their Speeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Df5CnXnVHC1mVINK]{Effect: Leader's Command}

YsvgwVrE3Hi7TA4L.name: Pike and Strike
YsvgwVrE3Hi7TA4L.description: The leader Strikes with their naval pike. If this Strike hits, the leader can either move the target 5 feet within the pike's reach or make a sap Strike against the target without increasing their multiple attack penalty until after the sap Strike.

Commodore Sticky Fingers.name: Commodore Sticky Fingers
Commodore Sticky Fingers.description:
The mischievous dragon sprites called draxies have dueled their pixie cousins for the title of ultimate prankster for centuries. They exercise patience and planning to create the perfect pranks, spending months, or even years, on their efforts. One exception to their flighty nature is the elucrea, a lifelong bond between a draxie and a creature they're particularly fond of, typically one with a good sense of humor. According to draxie legend, a little piece of a draxie's spirit remembers being united as the ancient fey dragonet Elucredassa, and that causes draxies to yearn for such connections with others.

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary, all sprites share a connection to magic and a diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.

5eqtzIqWpDscyCIh.name: Breath Weapon
5eqtzIqWpDscyCIh.description:
The draxie breathes pixie dust in a @Template[cone|distance:15], with a random effect determined each time they use their Breath Weapon. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the effect. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:14] save or be affected.

The draxie can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

  1. The target takes the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} spell.
  2. The target loses its last 5 minutes of memory.
  3. The target takes the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep} spell.
  4. For 1 minute, the target is in a state of euphoria that makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

B8BTP8SDX42aw7zd.name: Gang Up
B8BTP8SDX42aw7zd.description: Any enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the tough robber's melee attacks due to flanking as long as the enemy is within melee reach of both the tough robber and one of the tough robber's allies.

xd9p9uinHbhg8vp8.name: Sneak Attack
xd9p9uinHbhg8vp8.description: The experienced robber leads an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Arrogant Entodemonologist.name: Arrogant Entodemonologist
Arrogant Entodemonologist.description:
Demonologists can pull a creature from the Abyss and bend it to their will... for a time.

Those initiated into the hidden truths and forbidden secrets of the world are forever transformed-or so they claim. To the cynical, a mystic is nothing more than a charlatan or zealot. Others profess to sense an aura around such luminaries and treat them with reverence, lest they offend some harbinger of unspeakable doom.

r7KR9Je1vjNvU6Gd.name: Command Demon
r7KR9Je1vjNvU6Gd.description:
Requirements The entodemonologist has a demon ally in melee with an enemy

Effect The entodemonologist commands their ally to attack. The demon ally uses its reaction to make a Strike against its opponent.

G8XPvTQvA65moKUG.name: Close-Quarters Fighting
G8XPvTQvA65moKUG.description: The blue-scarf heavy gains a +4 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures they have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

3KwlsgEPBvaYe7W3.name: Sudden Rush
3KwlsgEPBvaYe7W3.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The blue-scarf heavy strides up to 10 feet and attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a creature. If they succeed, they also deal fist damage to that creature.

Ghessa (5-6).name: Ghessa (5-6)
Ghessa (5-6).description:
A monk who violated their monastic vows in life might arise after death to become an undead horror known as a kurobozu. These predators feast upon the breath of mortals, creeping on twisted limbs into bedrooms to steal the life from sleeping victims. This act of feeding leaves its mark on the victim in the form of a vile scent of rot on the victim's breath and a debilitating disease that eventually results in exhaustion and finally death.

Kurobozus retain echoes of their ascetic training, enabling them to suck the breath from debilitated foes in the midst of battle. Their malevolent cunning combined with ascetic discipline helps them concoct elaborate and lengthy schemes to enact their jealous revenge. Few kurobozus are convincing enough to persuade their onetime allies to break their own oaths, but this doesn't stop them from making the attempt.

CHKrjbjG2iuM6dGa.name: Black Apoxia
CHKrjbjG2iuM6dGa.description:
The target can't recover from the fatigued condition caused by black apoxia until the disease is cured

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:24]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and fatigued (1 day)

Stage 4 dead

zTFuXpu6BuPdbg6N.name: Brawling Critical
zTFuXpu6BuPdbg6N.description: When the kurobozu scores a critical hit with an unarmed attack, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn.

gzZaUElRwVXoDLly.name: Sagebane
gzZaUElRwVXoDLly.description: When the kurobozu damages a living creature with an unarmed Strike, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute. Further damage dealt by the kurobozu resets the duration to 1 minute and increases the stupefied value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4}.

BurQSnXk9enXhVZH.name: Steal Breath
BurQSnXk9enXhVZH.description:
Requirements The kurobozu is adjacent to a living creature that is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}

Effect The kurobozu leans over and sucks the breath from the target, who must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save. Regardless of the result, the creature is exposed to black apoxia and its breath reeks of carrion for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature can't speak for 1 minute.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and can't speak for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, plus the creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} and begins suffocating.

lcGPZQiY2GFPXOVQ.name: Stunning Flurry
lcGPZQiY2GFPXOVQ.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The kurobozu makes two unarmed Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses, and the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:23|traits:incapacitation] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure); this save has the incapacitation trait.

zaD6IUn59EF4mqzi.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

6SDloGsttpr7ZAJq.name: Hatred of Beauty
6SDloGsttpr7ZAJq.description:
While aghashes hate all mortals, they particularly despise beautiful objects and beautiful or charismatic mortals. When not in physical peril, an aghash is compelled to destroy art and other works of beauty. An aghash can't enter an area of pristine beauty without first marring it in some way.

Given a choice, an aghash attacks a foe with the highest Charisma score first. If barred from doing so by force or some magical effect, they take @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage at the end of their turn.

4SUjs1Fnnil2m2Qt.name: Cursed Gaze
4SUjs1Fnnil2m2Qt.description:
The aghash fixes their gaze on one creature they can see within 20 feet. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage and becomes either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (the aghash's choice).

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Fil9NBsfO3iADreb.name: Sandstorm
Fil9NBsfO3iADreb.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The aghash creates a temporary sandstorm in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] that lasts for 1 minute.

Creatures within the emanation take a -4 circumstance penalty to Perception checks and must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save. On a failure, they're forced to hold their breath or else they start suffocating. A creature within the sandstorm at the end of its turn takes @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage.

Divs are immune to all effects of an aghash's sandstorm.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.f8rncEs06bqcn3LZ]{Effect: Sandstorm}

ZMWoArzOhnNivtl2.name: Shadowed Illumination
ZMWoArzOhnNivtl2.description: Shadow pixies exude shadow, counteracting all other light and darkness effects their level or lower to leave dim light out to 10 feet (counteract rank 1, counteract bonus [[/r 1d20+7 #Counteract]]{+7}). The shadow pixie can suppress this effect with a single action, which has the concentrate trait. While the effect is suppressed, the shadow pixie's Strikes don't deal cold damage and they can't use their shadow spark Strike.

I5hUXCEAx9YUdyA0.name: Hidden Movement
I5hUXCEAx9YUdyA0.description: If the assassins' guild rogue starts its turn undetected by a creature or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from it, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the rogue's attacks until the end of the rogue's turn.

loEYWNHauhzET7yP.name: Sneak Attack
loEYWNHauhzET7yP.description: The assassins' guild rogue deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

eHTffn3HeutAp4vD.name: Snatch Up
eHTffn3HeutAp4vD.description:
Trigger A creature leaves the swarm's space

Effect The creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save to escape the swarm's space or they are picked up and thrown 5 feet, taking @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Eyv2i0G0kG3hK3hO.name: Echolocation
Eyv2i0G0kG3hK3hO.description: A bat can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

FiI2bWuRneIPIYMW.name: Swarming Bites
FiI2bWuRneIPIYMW.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[1d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save).

Germinated Mandragora.name: Germinated Mandragora
Germinated Mandragora.description:
A mandragora looks like a freshly pulled tuber that has grown into the malformed shape of a child with a grotesque face and hideously bloated body. These insidious little plants typically form when a mandrake root is watered with a demon's blood. Upon absorbing the otherworldly properties of the demon's blood, the root animates and is forced to seek out blood to feast from, lest it die of thirst.

Always famished and in search for sustenance, mandragoras live haunted, pained lives and perform vile and desperate acts to acquire the blood they crave. While they prefer magically infused blood such as that of unicorns, fey, or sorcerers, and they can also feed off of potions, alchemical bombs, and other magical elixirs, a mandragora can subsist on the blood of non-magical creatures. They find the flavor of mundane blood to be bland and bitter, and they do not blanch at voicing these complaints to the creatures from which they drink.

While the typical mandragora is the size of a human child, some of these evil plants continue to grow and grow, reaching sizes more comparable to those of giants. Sometimes as they grow, they form additional limbs or rudimentary faces, eventually transforming into truly hideous mockeries of the human form.

ZvqnxVWvm9QdJZVi.name: Blood Scent
ZvqnxVWvm9QdJZVi.description: A germinated mandragora can smell creatures with blood as an imprecise scent at a range of 30 feet, and it can smell demons, fey, and sorcerers with blood as a precise sense at a range of 30 feet.

uQFiXxjHXOCxLHe8.name: Vulnerability to Supernatural Darkness
uQFiXxjHXOCxLHe8.description: Whenever a germinated mandragora begins its turn in an area of magical darkness, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} on that turn.

sfWdhP3dRBdtmiol.name: Blood Drain
sfWdhP3dRBdtmiol.description:
Requirements The germinated mandragora has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The germinated mandragora drains blood from the creature it has grabbed, dealing @Damage[1d6[untyped]] damage. If the creature is a demon, fey, or sorcerer, the germinated mandragora gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its blood drained by a germinated mandragora is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing of any kind or amount.

wrisTXltKN2ggF1B.name: Mandragora Venom
wrisTXltKN2ggF1B.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

w0XMZ6GmkzJcCRyO.name: Piercing Shriek
w0XMZ6GmkzJcCRyO.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The germinated mandragora emits an unsettling shriek. Each non-mandragora creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is sickened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. As long as the creature remains sickened, this slowed condition value can't be reduced below 1.

KtD1ynKI4uZ3aaVz.name: Faceglomph
KtD1ynKI4uZ3aaVz.description:
Trigger The sharktopus eidolon makes a successful tentacle strike

Effect the sharktopus makes an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}. If it is successful, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until it escapes.

Barnacle Barnaby.name: Barnacle Barnaby
Barnacle Barnaby.description:
Feared by mariners and coastal dwellers everywhere, the aquatic ghouls known as lacedons are said to be the spawn of an ancient crew of sailors who became lost at sea and were forced to resort to cannibalism to survive. Their appearance is the stuff of a diver's nightmare, supplementing the vicious traits of their land-bound kin with spines, fins, and wide mouths bristling with needle-sharp teeth like piscine predators of the nethermost ocean depths.

Devious and cunning, ghouls can be found anywhere corpses are laid to rest, forever seeking to satisfy their boundless craving for humanoid flesh.

vkuk04wj4sfihq3b.name: Corpse Scent (Imprecise) 1 mile
vkuk04wj4sfihq3b.description: The lacedon can smell humanoid corpses in the water from up to 1 mile away.

Uc4DijFU9ApvpWFZ.name: Consume Flesh
Uc4DijFU9ApvpWFZ.description:
Requirements The lacedon is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The lacedon devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[2d6[healing]] Hit Points. It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

MYPGBIYRPHho61zG.name: Ghoul Fever
MYPGBIYRPHho61zG.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

dtbhcid8fzmfjtp7.name: Paralyzing Spew
dtbhcid8fzmfjtp7.description: The lacedon discharges a spray of carrion vomit at a creature within 20 feet, dealing @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:19|basic]. A non-elf creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save to end the paralysis at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save. The lacedon can't use Paralyzing Spew again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Paralyzing Spew]]{1d4 rounds}.

Exhausted Raja Rakshasa.name: Exhausted Raja Rakshasa
Exhausted Raja Rakshasa.description:
When not disguised as a humanoid, the raja rakshasa has the head of an animal. The hands of a raja rakshasa are more subtly unsettling, for the fingers of these fiends bend outward, away from the palms.

More than any other types of rakshasa, rajas scoff at religion. They understand the power of the divine, yet they view themselves as the only things worthy of worship from mortal creatures; not even their own immortals are deemed deserving of such glorification. Raja rakshasas often form close-knit families that work together to bring down mortal cities or to rule them from the shadows within. Such families of rakshasas often incorporate other breeds of the fiend, often using dandasukas as favored servants or stealthy spies. Even though a raja family works together to achieve a shared goal, infighting and treachery among their own is a constant threat.

Rakshasas are evil spirits that cloak themselves in the guises of humanoid creatures, that they might walk unseen among their prey. They embody what is taboo among most societies, and in the shape of those they seek to defile, rakshasas gorge themselves on these hideous acts. A wide range of rakshasas exist; presented below are the diminutive, sinister dandasuka rakshasa and the infamous raja rakshasa, who are the most widespread and commonly encountered of these fiends.

uZdepeycCi1DBYTW.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

wbhIx2xtiqZn73im.name: +3 Status to All Saves vs. Divine Magic

fTBOn2wHEnOkR4t9.name: Scoff at the Divine
fTBOn2wHEnOkR4t9.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet casts a divine spell or uses a divine ability

Requirements The raja rakshasa has an unexpended spell slot that can be used to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}

Effect The raja rakshasa expends a spell slot that could be used to cast dispel magic and attempts to counteract the triggering spell or ability. The raja rakshasa can't Scoff at the Divine for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

0lFm2C1Slc60GuoD.name: Change Shape
0lFm2C1Slc60GuoD.description:
The raja rakshasa takes on the appearance of any Medium humanoid. This doesn't change the raja rakshasa's Speed or its attack and damage modifiers with its Strikes but might change the damage type its Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning). It typically loses its fangs Strike unless the humanoid form has fangs or a similar unarmed attack.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Arcadian Lurker In Light.name: Arcadian Lurker In Light
Arcadian Lurker In Light.description:
These malicious and strange fey appear as fairies about 2 feet tall, with insectile wings, large eyes, and bulbous heads. They slaughter and cause mischief in a pattern only their alien intellect understands, but they've been seen to take particular umbrage against dwarves, gnomes, and creatures who live in darkness. With their grudges and pursuit of their own wicked and sadistic whims, lurkers in light deftly overturn the conventional wisdom that creatures associated with light are benign and friendly.

While lurkers in light are fey and have ties to the First World, these creatures are often found elsewhere in the Great Beyond. They are particularly fond of invading the Shadow Plane to bring light to those who dwell there-not to help, but to spread misery and pain among those to whom light is agonizing.

bEAhPwJXnrqxPt5i.name: Blend with Light
bEAhPwJXnrqxPt5i.description:
Trigger The lurker in light uses a move action

Requirements The lurker in light is in an area of bright light

Effect The lurker in light becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} until it enters an area of dim light or darkness, or until it uses a hostile action.

7ibCw6e1BSbQ94NW.name: Lurker's Glow
7ibCw6e1BSbQ94NW.description:
A creature that takes damage from a lurker in light's mote of light must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save.

Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to lurker's glow for 24 hours.

Failure The creature is lined in golden light for 1 minute and can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} during this time. If the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}, it is concealed rather than being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature sheds bright light in a 20-foot emanation for the duration of the effect. In addition, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} on its first turn after failing this save.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.6E8bOkwFzFuQ3ZAw]{Effect: Lurker's Glow (Critical Failure)}

nQV7pNdpGD2GDrgl.name: Sneak Attack
nQV7pNdpGD2GDrgl.description: A lurker in light's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Eyv2i0G0kG3hK3hO.name: Echolocation
Eyv2i0G0kG3hK3hO.description: A bat can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

guTg7fvEcAWZvRM9.name: Treasure Toss
guTg7fvEcAWZvRM9.description: The hoarding bat scoops up a rock or nearby item and throws it at an enemy within 30 feet. The targeted creature must succeed on a @Check[reflex|dc:17] save or take @Damage[(1d6+2)[bludgeoning]] damage.

Metal Rascal.name: Metal Rascal
Metal Rascal.description: The capricious and destructive metal scamps are self-appointed forces of entropy, taking great pleasure in indiscriminately wrecking everything around them, sometimes even to their own detriment. Metal scamps have a severe appearance, with pointed facial features and angular limbs, and their skin can be the color of any metal, often heavily oxidized as if by years of exposure to the elements.

rzwY2cdJOfsVqX2R.name: Breathe Shrapnel
rzwY2cdJOfsVqX2R.description:
The metal scamp breathes a @Template[cone|distance:15] of jagged metal flakes that deals @Damage[(2d4)[slashing],(1d4)[bleed]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The metal scamp can't Breathe Shrapnel again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breathe Shrapnel]]{1d4 rounds}.

Bloodied Kithangian.name: Bloodied Kithangian
Bloodied Kithangian.description: The kithangian—a horrifying amalgam of horse and scorpion also known as a "beast demon"—is a foul fend born of the souls of mortals who abused and tormented animals in life. Kithangians tend to roam wild areas rife with animals to torture, though humanoid settlements with plenty of pets or livestock also make for tantalizing hunting grounds. Uncontested for too long, a kithangian's presence has a corrupting influence on the local fauna, which birth fiendish monstrosities until the demon is vanquished. If it realizes it's being tracked by vengeful druids or demon slayers, a kithangian assumes the shape of an unassuming animal so it can get the jump on its pursuers.

kDYWO0k0ThZhWcAH.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

AXIbwimQwwZXY5La.name: Animal Kindness Vulnerability
AXIbwimQwwZXY5La.description: Kithangians find kindness to animals revolting. The first time each round that a kithangian sees someone heal or otherwise provide aid to a creature that has the animal trait, the kithangian takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage.

FsQWwjREZfdxra5l.name: Change Shape
FsQWwjREZfdxra5l.description:
The kithangian can take on the appearance of any Medium or Large animal. This doesn't change its Speed or their attack and damage modif ers with its Strikes, but it might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

ZKaduXctpn6ATVjC.name: Kithangian Venom
ZKaduXctpn6ATVjC.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:23]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] (2 rounds)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (2 rounds)

Stage 3 @Damage[3d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (2 rounds)

CoQTAk22h5lnU6tR.name: Rasping Tongues
CoQTAk22h5lnU6tR.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements The kithangian has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in one or both pincers

Effect Barbed tongues slither out of the faces in the kithangian's pincers. The tongues burrow into grabbed creatures and inject their minds with haunting psychic screams. Each grabbed creature takes @Damage[2d8[piercing],2d8[mental]]{2d8 piercing and 2d8 mental}. A creature can try to resist the mental damage by attempting a @Check[will|dc:23|basic].

Y6Gy3tHtrZry8mhp.name: Hydration
Y6Gy3tHtrZry8mhp.description: Azarketi must regularly submerge themselves in water to rehydrate their water-acclimated skin. After the first 24 hours outside of water, they gain a –1 status penalty to Fortitude saves as their skin cracks and their gills become painful. After 48 hours, they struggle to breathe air and begin to suffocate until returned to water.

pbwXaaeC2q0N1edB.name: Submerged Stealth
pbwXaaeC2q0N1edB.description: While submerged in water, an azarketi ruffian gains a +2 circumstance bonus on their Stealth check, indicated above.

Blazing Skull.name: Blazing Skull
Blazing Skull.description:
More dangerous than simple severed heads, these skulls are wreathed in unearthly flames.

Beheaded are the reanimated heads of decapitation victims. These mindless undead fly through the air or roll around to attack their prey.

IzAYt0TOGDn03Iuj.name: Fiery Explosion
IzAYt0TOGDn03Iuj.description: When destroyed, a blazing skull explodes in a blast of fire and bone that deals @Damage[1d6[piercing],1d6[fire]]{1d6 piercing damage plus 1d6 fire damage} to each adjacent creature (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).

AJK2FzoU6wIUxE43.name: Flaming Shroud
AJK2FzoU6wIUxE43.description: A flaming skull is shrouded in hideous flames. It deals @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage to any unattended item it touches and on a forehead Strike. On a critical hit with a Strike, the target catches fire, taking @Damage[1d4[persistent,fire]].

Shadow Draugr.name: Shadow Draugr
Shadow Draugr.description:
Risen corpses of sailors who died at sea, draugr reek of the rot and decay of the briny deep. Their eyes glow with ghastly green light, and rotting seaweed, barnacles, and dead sea creatures cling to their bodies. Draugr can't speak, but expresses their malicious emotions with gurgles, as though they were eternally drowning with lungs full of water. They desire little more than to attack living creatures, especially those who sail the sea. Even when they go upon land, draugrs often drag the corpses of those they strike down back to the water, populating the depths with even more dead.

Draugr rise in the haunted places of the sea, where restless spirits, swells of void energy, or supernatural storms deliver death. A corpse might rest at the bottom of the sea for some time before awakening as a draugr. Collecting detritus and organisms, a corpse becomes increasingly disgusting before it finally rises. Proximity to intelligent life can expedite this process, and an underwater explorer who happens upon a shipwreck might cause a body to snap to unlife as a draugr suddenly. The creatures don't take intrusions lightly, especially upon their place of death.

Though steeped in evil, draugr are susceptible to reminders of their lives as mariners. In particular, a well-performed sea shanty or call-and-response work song might cause a draugr to become lost in reverie for a moment. The creatures have even been witnessed moaning along, unable to sing the words but providing haunting accompaniment. The lull rarely lasts long, though, as the beauty of the song quickly becomes a reminder of the tragedy that befell the draugr, reaffirming their desire for blood and death.

More powerful draugr with burning red eyes are called draugr captains. They're 3rd-level creatures with elite adjustments that can cast obscuring mist as an innate divine spell three times per day.

h0VU0sBf5jz6KCu1.name: The Void's Revenge
h0VU0sBf5jz6KCu1.description: A creature that slays a shadow draugr is subjected to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{Mariner's Curse} spell with a @Check[will|dc:17|traits:spell] save. The curse ends if the draugr is buried in a calm sea or after 1 week passes.

cjYLiElA3muRcJuo.name: Grotesque Gift
cjYLiElA3muRcJuo.description: The shadow draugr's attacks spatter their targets with rancid flesh and rotting seaweed. A creature damaged by a draugr's Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:15] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

bS27ihuZ0Xs3mU7a.name: Swipe
bS27ihuZ0Xs3mU7a.description: The shadow draugr makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within its melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A Swipe counts as two attacks for the draugr's multiple attack penalty.

F0Qiqu85YD5e8VwX.name: Bound Impotence
F0Qiqu85YD5e8VwX.description: Wanikkawi becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} if he has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} condition.

9iJNFZ3As2w4K8TU.name: Attack of Opportunity (Special)
9iJNFZ3As2w4K8TU.description:
jaws only.

On a critical success, Wanikkawi can immediately attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grab} as a free action.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

PihtyYXhXXq2gdAT.name: Demand Pact
PihtyYXhXXq2gdAT.description:
Frequency once per turn

Effect Wanikkawi attempts to force a creature within 30 feet that he is aware of to agree to a pact with him. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:28] save. Its effects depend on the variation; see below. Afterward, the creature gains temporary immunity for 1 day.

Each time you run this scenario, select one of the following variations to apply to Wanikkawi's Demand Pact ability:

Pact of Glory

Wanikkawi declares the target can attain fame by betraying their companions and staying out of the fight. He promises to let them survive the battle and claim that they drove him away despite the deaths of their friends. Demand Pact gains the following results:

Critical Success Wanikkawi's hatred for others overcomes him. He does not treat any other creatures as allies for 1 round.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature does not treat any other creature as an ally for 1 round. It doesn't become hostile but can't take an action (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds} or Aid) or cast a spell to directly benefit any creature but itself. It doesn't count as an ally for the purposes of flanking.

Critical Failure As above, but the creature also can't attack another creature. It can take actions that only target itself.

Pact of Survival

Wanikkawi suggests the PC can survive, as he did so many years ago, by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} the fire. Demand Pact gains the following results:

Critical Success Wanikkawi remembers his own escape and must fight against that impulse. He gains a –10 status penalty to his speed for 1 round if he's in the firelight (–20 feet in bright light from the fire).

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is fleeing for a single action on its next turn.

Critical Failure The creature is fleeing for 1 round.

Pact of Power

Wanikkawi promises power by transforming them into a spirit, like he was. Demand Pact gains the following results:

Critical Success Wanikkawi becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} at the thought of his own transformation.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature takes on aspects of Wanikkawi's form for 1 minute. Because of this, if they enter or begin their turn in bright light caused by the fire, they become sickened 1 for 1 round.

Critical Failure As above, except the creature becomes sickened 1 if they enter or begin their turn in any light by the fire and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} in bright light caused by the fire. This condition remains for 1 minute.

Pact of Erasure

Wanikkawi threatens the PC's true story will be forgotten, as his was. Demand Pact gains the following results:

Critical Success The truth of what Wanikkawi did suddenly hits him. He's unable to use reactions for 1 round.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}, inaudible, and otherwise imperceptible to its allies for 1 round.

Critical Failure As above, but the creature's allies also forget about the creature for 1 round and can take no actions regarding the creature in that time. They remember the creature as usual after 1 round.

15vkTyt4gyjKg21T.name: Out of the Night
15vkTyt4gyjKg21T.description:
Requirements Wanikkawi is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to at least one enemy

Effect Wanikkawi Strides twice and makes a Strike against a creature he was hidden to at the start of his action at any point during his movement.

p7pspcasb3dgb8Gk.name: Double Opportunity
p7pspcasb3dgb8Gk.description: The two-headed goat gains an extra reaction each round that it can use only to make Attacks of Opportunity. It must use a different head for each reaction, and it can't use more than one on the same triggering action. If it loses one of its heads, it also loses this extra reaction.

ieFGm768pfF5Hpwe.name: Two Headed
ieFGm768pfF5Hpwe.description: Any ability that would sever one of the twoheaded goat's heads (such as a critical hit with a vorpal weapon) severs one head at random. Losing a head doesn't kill the two-headed goat (as long as it has one head left), but it does prevent it from making Strikes with the lost head or using the head's Breath Weapon.

mnagKCwE0GlV9NKy.name: Breath Weapon
mnagKCwE0GlV9NKy.description:
The two-headed goat breathes a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals 2d6 damage to all creatures in the area (DC 15 basic save of a type indicated below).

The two-headed goat can't use either of its Breath Weapons again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Markhor Cone of @Damage[2d6[poison]|options:area-damage] (@Check[fortitude|dc:15|basic|options:area-effect])
  • Saanen Cone of @Damage[2d6[fire]|options:area-damage] (@Check[reflex|dc:15|basic|options:area-effect])

B6uOLKXHlpUPyMD0.name: Elemental Bite
B6uOLKXHlpUPyMD0.description: Each head deals an extra 1d4 damage of a type matching the head's breath weapon.

l473DbGWeuvmCMaT.name: Two-Headed Strike
l473DbGWeuvmCMaT.description:
Frequency once per turn

Effect The two-headed goat makes a Strike with two of its heads, each at a –2 penalty and targeting a different creature. These Strikes count as only one attack for the two-headed goat's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after it has made both attacks.

Elite Commodore Sticky Fingers.name: Elite Commodore Sticky Fingers
Elite Commodore Sticky Fingers.description:
The mischievous dragon sprites called draxies have dueled their pixie cousins for the title of ultimate prankster for centuries. They exercise patience and planning to create the perfect pranks, spending months, or even years, on their efforts. One exception to their flighty nature is the elucrea, a lifelong bond between a draxie and a creature they're particularly fond of, typically one with a good sense of humor. According to draxie legend, a little piece of a draxie's spirit remembers being united as the ancient fey dragonet Elucredassa, and that causes draxies to yearn for such connections with others.

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary, all sprites share a connection to magic and a diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.

5eqtzIqWpDscyCIh.name: Breath Weapon
5eqtzIqWpDscyCIh.description:
The draxie breathes pixie dust in a @Template[cone|distance:15], with a random effect determined each time they use their Breath Weapon. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the effect. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:16] save or be affected.

The draxie can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

  1. The target takes the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} spell.
  2. The target loses its last 5 minutes of memory.
  3. The target takes the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep} spell.
  4. For 1 minute, the target is in a state of euphoria that makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Carcaras.name: Carcaras
Carcaras.description:
Crocodiles can be found basking on riverbanks, lurking in swamps, or floating in lakes. They are usually are indistinguishable from logs when viewed from afar-at least until they attack. Alligators have similar statistics, but because they often live in more temperate climates, they endure cold temperatures better. Unlike alligators, crocodiles can tolerate salt water. Both are formidable predators that are likely to devour careless adventurers who fail to watch where they step.

Powerful and primeval in appearance, crocodiles are dangerous natural predators that dwell in marshes, riverbeds, swamps, and other wetlands.

A0HAbzH4Gjn59ZLw.name: Deep Breath
A0HAbzH4Gjn59ZLw.description: The crocodile can hold its breath for about 2 hours.

VJskqa7wKZznRwqe.name: Shockodile
VJskqa7wKZznRwqe.description: 10 feet. Creatures that enter or end their turn inside the aura take @Damage[1d4[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save)

WLCM7iPJWfoRusL5.name: Death Roll
WLCM7iPJWfoRusL5.description:
Requirements The crocodile must have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Effect The crocodile tucks its legs and rolls rapidly, twisting its victim. It makes a jaws Strike with a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll against the grabbed creature. If it hits, it also knocks the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If it fails, it releases the creature.

kSd8rIlnXiVczYg0.name: Deny Advantage
kSd8rIlnXiVczYg0.description: Krosovahn Mendesil isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 5th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using surprise attack.

qNEPB3RKC3SlV4YE.name: Surprise Attack
qNEPB3RKC3SlV4YE.description: On the first round of combat, if Krosovahn Mendesil rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures who haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Krosovahn Mendesil.

b4eGXoRWpidh8A9B.name: You're Next
b4eGXoRWpidh8A9B.description:
Trigger Krosovahn Mendesil reduces an enemy to 0 Hit Points

Effect After downing the foe, Krosovahn Mendesil menacingly reminds another foe that he's coming after them next. Krosovahn Mendesil attempts an Intimidation check with a +2 circumstance bonus to [[/act demoralize options=youre-next]] a single creature that he can see and that can see him.

wXgvnztT7r9jO7Px.name: Brutal Rally
wXgvnztT7r9jO7Px.description:
Trigger Krosovahn Mendesil rolls a critical hit against a creature

Effect All allies that can see Krosovahn Mendesil gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls until the start of Krosovahn Mendesil's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7x0O2GqWBJiAk5PF]{Effect: Brutal Rally}

PDidp7qMSw5qRoXU.name: Quick Draw
PDidp7qMSw5qRoXU.description: Krosovahn Mendesil Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.

j1wf4dSXkGypJjRs.name: Sneak Attack
j1wf4dSXkGypJjRs.description: Krosovahn Mendesil deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures

ays6fyEK9QKLppRK.name: Protection of the Burning Sun
ays6fyEK9QKLppRK.description: Whenever Uirch's shield is raised, he is granted a defensive aura of sacred fire. Any time he's hit while his shield is raised with a non-reach melee weapon or unarmed attack, the attacking opponent takes @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save.

Elite Mutant Cryptid Snapdrake.name: Elite Mutant Cryptid Snapdrake
Elite Mutant Cryptid Snapdrake.description: Skilled kizidhar mages and gardeners handcraft these lovely creatures as much for their shuyookhs' aesthetic pleasure as for their protection. Creating a snapdrake requires first painstakingly constructing a frame of living wood in the shape of a drake before weaving thousands of colorful snapdragon flowers into intricate patterns to form its body and scales. Once complete, snapdrakes often serve kizidhars as a combination of guards, pets, and decorations for as long as they are well fed.

oWKqHA1A1VMXlVm8.name: Alluring Scent
oWKqHA1A1VMXlVm8.description: 30 feet. A creature that enters the emanation must attempt a @Check[will|dc:28] save. On a failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the snapdrake and must use at least 1 action on its next turn to Stride closer to the snapdrake. On a success, the target is immune to the snapdrake's alluring scent for 1 hour.

ca38dLMDKd24UQE3.name: Explosive End
ca38dLMDKd24UQE3.description: The mutant snapdrake's death reveals one last surprise as it explodes into splinters. When it dies, it explodes, dealing @Damage[5d6[piercing]] damage to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10], with a basic @Check[reflex|dc:30] save.

7RD9b0b0ARSHZeZJ.name: Greater Forest Passage
7RD9b0b0ARSHZeZJ.description: The snapdrake ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from plants and fungi.

LE6KUpPto7uLf1bD.name: Marrowlance
LE6KUpPto7uLf1bD.description: The mutant cryptid can make wicked spears of bone erupt from its body. The creature can make marrowlance ranged unarmed attacks. Use the highest attack modifier from the creature's highest ranged Strike, as well as the damage from that Strike. If it has no ranged attacks, use moderate accuracy and low damage for the creature's level. Marrowlance unarmed attacks have a range of 60 feet and the versatile S trait.

JfmizJJ6WCZlKigo.name: Shifting Iridescence
JfmizJJ6WCZlKigo.description: Whenever the mutant snapdrake takes energy damage to which it isn't resistant or immune, after taking the damage normally, it gains resistance 10 to that damage type. If it had a resistance to a different damage type from shifting iridescence, it replaces the old resistance with the new resistance.

HAmEsoCS7jucJCnL.name: Snapdrake Pollen
HAmEsoCS7jucJCnL.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:30]

Maximum Duration 8 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage plus dazzled and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (2 rounds)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} and sickened 1 (2 rounds)

dupxU1QENo5dwXMD.name: Speed Surge
dupxU1QENo5dwXMD.description:
Frequency 3 times per day

Effect The snapdrake moves up to twice its Speed.

YsP0BTGgFbqhPJlq.name: Spray Pollen
YsP0BTGgFbqhPJlq.description: The snapdrake breathes a blast of pollen in a @Template[cone|distance:40]. Creatures caught in the blast must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save or be exposed to snapdrake pollen. The snapdrake can't use Spray Pollen again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Spray Pollen]]{1d6 rounds}.

yI5Ldk4hGFFE02Xs.name: Unusual Bane
yI5Ldk4hGFFE02Xs.description: This mutant snapdrake is traumatized by the former Conference Z staff who teamed up to hold it down while experimenting on it. The first time each round the mutant snapdrake comes within 15 feet of any character who took the Aid action, or is attacked while being flanked by two characters, it takes @Damage[10[mental]] damage and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save. On a failure, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure).

C5zKC61h7GcivnD5.name: Disgusted by Food
C5zKC61h7GcivnD5.description: The morrowkin eats dreams and potential, not food. A creature that spends an action to brandish food at the morrowkin automatically makes the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or increases its sickened value by 1, to a maximum of sickened 6), decreasing the morrowkin's AC, attack rolls, saves, skills, and ability DCs accordingly, as normal for the sickened condition. The morrowkin can't retch to reduce its sickened condition.

GufPL7fXAz1R4tFA.name: Endless
GufPL7fXAz1R4tFA.description: If reduced to 0 Hit Points or incapacitated for more than a few rounds, the morrowkin vanishes. In 1 hour, it reappears refreshed completely as if the previous battle never happened, with full HP, with all effects on it cleared, and with its Swallow Future ability ready to use again. This ability is severed if the Dark Tapestry segment it is tied to is removed.

Vcb2fzxMkjOhWNPz.name: Drain Potential
Vcb2fzxMkjOhWNPz.description: The morrowkin tries to drain the motivation from its target, who must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:29] save. If the target fails, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2} on a critical failure) and must roll twice and use the worse result on all checks for 1 minute. Creatures wearing a hope talisman are unaffected.

sxD01nPswudJsjzS.name: Swallow Future
sxD01nPswudJsjzS.description:
The morrowkin inhales and draws forth the future deeds of all creatures around it. All creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:30] of the morrowkin take @Damage[(5d8+18)[mental]] damage and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:32] save. The morrowkin can't Swallow Future again for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 3}.

pAa1q5ts9oP6qdky.name: Tomorrow's Fury
pAa1q5ts9oP6qdky.description: The morrowkin makes claw attacks against any number of targets within reach. The claw attacks count against the morrowkin's multiple attack penalty, but don't apply the penalty until after all attacks have been made.

pVbB1gSZAFJU6rqe.name: Vulkariki Athletics
pVbB1gSZAFJU6rqe.description: A vulkariki eidolon can use Acrobatics instead of Athletics on checks normally requiring Athletics.

bvx1dx28ijDBiYhD.name: Vulkariki Tricks
bvx1dx28ijDBiYhD.description: A vulkariki eidolon can use Acrobatics instead of Thievery to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ijZ0DDFpMkWqaShd]{Palm an Object} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal}.

Weak Cacophonous Hound Echo.name: Weak Cacophonous Hound Echo
Weak Cacophonous Hound Echo.description:
Lean and athirst, the hounds of Tindalos are drawn to those who tamper with the flow of time, travel through time, or use magic or rare alchemical drugs to send their thoughts or perception back or forward in time. Powerful spellcasters can draw them from the Dimension of Time via rare rituals, but doing so attracts the hounds' ire, so few who traffic in such rituals live long enough to spread their knowledge. While the hounds possess great cunning and cruel intellect, they rarely interact with other creatures-other than to hunt and destroy those who have attracted their unblinking attention.

Once a hound catches scent of a mortal to hunt, it calls others of its ilk. The pack then pursues its victim through all space and time until it catches, slays and devours them. Those pursued can escape only by avoiding all angles, as hounds of Tindalos could step through them from nothingness at any time.

1IvCoMHs0qGTlw8J.name: Churning Gaze
1IvCoMHs0qGTlw8J.description: 30 feet. The hound echo's eyes glow balefully, causing the internal organs of a creature that meets its awful gaze to churn and spasm. When a creature ends its turn in the aura's emanation, it must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). A creature that critically succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

u6tuxFGclP3Cf3u2.name: Otherworldly Mind
u6tuxFGclP3Cf3u2.description: Whenever a creature targets the hound with a mental effect, that creature takes @Damage[(1d6+2)[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:21|basic] save). On a failure, it also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

kuV1kCq4ZEiH9DzH.name: Vulnerable to Curved Space
kuV1kCq4ZEiH9DzH.description:
When a hound echo is not adjacent to a structural angle of 90° (or more acute), its resistance to physical damage is suppressed and it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. It can't recover from this sickened condition, but the condition ends automatically once the hound is again adjacent to a suitable angle.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.V60TWjo1G1r5ZtPM]{Effect: Vulnerable to Curved Space}

xq3V1P1OXiEGcqZs.name: Limited Angled Entry
xq3V1P1OXiEGcqZs.description:
The hound echo casts a 4th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate} spell, but it must transport itself into a space it can see that is adjacent to an angle of 90° (or more acute) in the structure or environment around it. For example, it could teleport to a space adjacent to a wall (using the angle between the wall and floor) or a corner in a room, or adjacent to a sizable tree growing straight up out of the ground, but not to a flat plain or a room with only curved corners and edges. It can't use Limited Angled Entry again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Limited Angled Entry]]{1d4 rounds}.

Once per day, the hound can use this ability to plane shift to or from the Dimension of Time, with the same restrictions on what angles it can appear next to.

edVOzLc3F3r5J4cg.name: Sneak Attack
edVOzLc3F3r5J4cg.description: The tough robber leads an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
