ndb38T4ZPWBZUJZB.name: Stunning Critical
ndb38T4ZPWBZUJZB.description: When the experienced robber deals damage on a critical hit, the target is knocked back 10 feet and must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. On a critical failure, the target also falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

nwkCMTCX0B1XgOaO.name: Infused Items
nwkCMTCX0B1XgOaO.description: 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Acid Flask (Moderate)}, 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)}, 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.hDLbR56Id2OtU318]{Elixir of Life (Minor)}, 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Z9TThSU2KtCX9gfD]{Vexing Vapor (Moderate)}. These items last for 24 hours or until Trapmaster Tok makes his next daily preparations.

zccYiocIsj31DcFd.name: Hurried Retreat
zccYiocIsj31DcFd.description:
Requirements Tok is adjacent to at least one enemy

Effect He Strides up to his speed plus 5 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. He must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.

5zAIOXNSJPfE0i1A.name: Quick Bomber
5zAIOXNSJPfE0i1A.description: Interact to draw and Strike to throw a bomb

8vMNeqyGSQxqqORR.name: Quicktrap
8vMNeqyGSQxqqORR.description:
Requirements Tok is adjacent to an empty space, is not adjacent to an enemy, and did not take this action in the previous round

Effect Tok quickly rigs a new @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pfs-season-5-bestiary.Actor.CqixjbeBxscOlzt6]{Trap} in the empty space.

Hound Echo.name: Hound Echo
Hound Echo.description:
Lean and athirst, the hounds of Tindalos are drawn to those who tamper with the flow of time, travel through time, or use magic or rare alchemical drugs to send their thoughts or perception back or forward in time. Powerful spellcasters can draw them from the Dimension of Time via rare rituals, but doing so attracts the hounds' ire, so few who traffic in such rituals live long enough to spread their knowledge. While the hounds possess great cunning and cruel intellect, they rarely interact with other creatures-other than to hunt and destroy those who have attracted their unblinking attention.

Once a hound catches scent of a mortal to hunt, it calls others of its ilk. The pack then pursues its victim through all space and time until it catches, slays and devours them. Those pursued can escape only by avoiding all angles, as hounds of Tindalos could step through them from nothingness at any time.

Weary Raja Rakshasa.name: Weary Raja Rakshasa
Weary Raja Rakshasa.description:
When not disguised as a humanoid, the raja rakshasa has the head of an animal. The hands of a raja rakshasa are more subtly unsettling, for the fingers of these fiends bend outward, away from the palms.

More than any other types of rakshasa, rajas scoff at religion. They understand the power of the divine, yet they view themselves as the only things worthy of worship from mortal creatures; not even their own immortals are deemed deserving of such glorification. Raja rakshasas often form close-knit families that work together to bring down mortal cities or to rule them from the shadows within. Such families of rakshasas often incorporate other breeds of the fiend, often using dandasukas as favored servants or stealthy spies. Even though a raja family works together to achieve a shared goal, infighting and treachery among their own is a constant threat.

Rakshasas are evil spirits that cloak themselves in the guises of humanoid creatures, that they might walk unseen among their prey. They embody what is taboo among most societies, and in the shape of those they seek to defile, rakshasas gorge themselves on these hideous acts. A wide range of rakshasas exist; presented below are the diminutive, sinister dandasuka rakshasa and the infamous raja rakshasa, who are the most widespread and commonly encountered of these fiends.

uZdepeycCi1DBYTW.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

wbhIx2xtiqZn73im.name: +3 Status to All Saves vs. Divine Magic

fTBOn2wHEnOkR4t9.name: Scoff at the Divine
fTBOn2wHEnOkR4t9.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet casts a divine spell or uses a divine ability

Requirements The raja rakshasa has an unexpended spell slot that can be used to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}

Effect The raja rakshasa expends a spell slot that could be used to cast dispel magic and attempts to counteract the triggering spell or ability. The raja rakshasa can't Scoff at the Divine for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

0lFm2C1Slc60GuoD.name: Change Shape
0lFm2C1Slc60GuoD.description:
The raja rakshasa takes on the appearance of any Medium humanoid. This doesn't change the raja rakshasa's Speed or its attack and damage modifiers with its Strikes but might change the damage type its Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning). It typically loses its fangs Strike unless the humanoid form has fangs or a similar unarmed attack.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

J5WIMcWCB5zwrJaU.name: Change Shape
J5WIMcWCB5zwrJaU.description:
The tanuki can transform into a mundane raccoon dog, using the statistics of pest form. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The tanuki loses any unarmed Strikes they gained from a tanuki heritage or ancestry feat in this form. The tanuki can remain in the raccoon dog form indefinitely, and can shift back to the tanuki form by using this action again.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

9qvkUiI475s7t3wW.name: Diverse Training
9qvkUiI475s7t3wW.description:
Each individual tanuki replaces their skill bonus in one skill with +10. Additionally, they get abilities as listed below.

Dainiki Nature

Ability The tanuki gains a +2 bonus on ranged attack rolls with shuriken and may

Mark Target 1 the tanuki chooses a target he can see. Once per round, the tanuki may deal an additional 1d8 precision damage to this target on a successful strike. This choice lasts until the tanuki chooses a new target with Mark Target.

Kagebashi Acrobatics

Ability The tanuki's fist deals electricity damage instead of bludgeoning damage, and he gains

Kinetic Strike 2 the tanuki makes a fist strike gaining a +4 status bonus to the damage roll.

Mochi Performance

Ability The tanuki gains the inspire courage composition cantrip.

Suzu Religion

Ability The tanuki can cast 1st-level electric arc at will as a primal innate spell (DC 18).

Tonta Athletics

Ability The damage die for the tanuki's fist increases to 1d6, and he gains

Flurry of Blows 1

Frequency once per round.

the tanuki makes two strikes

Toshiro Deception

Ability The tanuki deals an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures, and on the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted are off-guard to him.

aUJAYN4u00MuN0hv.name: Flurry of Blows (Tonta Only)
aUJAYN4u00MuN0hv.description:
Frequency once per round.

The tanuki makes two strikes.

OtVV6rDFWGOxLwiV.name: Kinetic Strike (Kagebashi Only)
OtVV6rDFWGOxLwiV.description: The tanuki makes a fist strike gaining a +4 status bonus to the damage roll.

i3cq0s6Q2cOrhZl9.name: Mark Target (Dainiki Only)
i3cq0s6Q2cOrhZl9.description: The tanuki chooses a target he can see. Once per round, the tanuki may deal an additional 1d8 precision damage to this target on a successful strike. This choice lasts until the tanuki chooses a new target with Mark Target.

Omertius, The Gorger.name: Omertius, The Gorger
Omertius, The Gorger.description: For most demons, possessing a creature requires a ritual, magic item, or condition, but for invidiaks, who lack a body, possession is akin to donning a suit of clothing. Known also as shadow demons, invidiaks are formed from envious mortal souls.

qRpjdfZvdGYi248g.name: Blood Possession
qRpjdfZvdGYi248g.description:
Omertius sends himself into his target's blood, controlling them as if af ected by the spell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession}. The target attempts a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] check. Omertius can Dismiss the spell at any time.

Critical Success The target is unafected.

Success Omertius possesses the target but can't control it.

Failure Omertius possesses the target and takes partial control. He no longer has a separate turn; instead, he might control the target. At the start of each of the target's turns, it attempts another Will save. If it fails, it's controlled by Omertius on that turn; if it succeeds, it chooses its own actions; and if it critically succeeds, it forces him out and the spell ends.

Critical Failure Omertius possesses the target fully, and the target can only watch as he manipulates it like a puppet. The target is controlled by Omertius.

AQV3xwBG3qhhy7JJ.name: Swarming Bites
AQV3xwBG3qhhy7JJ.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).

Ashen Brimorak.name: Ashen Brimorak
Ashen Brimorak.description:
These goat-headed demons have glowing red eyes and flaming hooves but measure only about 3 feet in height. Born from the souls of arsonists, the fiery brimoraks continue the work they pursued in life, as everything they touch quickly burns.

As a general rule, brimoraks are ill-tempered even for demons, although their spite turns to glee in the face of a growing fire. Those who have survived encounters with these fiends report that they remember the braying sound of the brimoraks' laughter as clearly as the heat of the flames or the choking scent of smoke.

Mortal souls that have been twisted and corrupted by sin sometimes arise in the afterlife as demons. These powerful and destructive fiends seek to spread their particular sin to warp more souls, thereby bolstering their numbers and continuing the cycle.

MzHIjOVqhOXnluws.name: Extinguishing Aversion
MzHIjOVqhOXnluws.description: Dousing a brimorak with water, either ordinary water or from a water effect, causes no physical harm to the fiend but deals @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage. Fully immersing the brimorak in water deals @Damage[5d6[mental]] damage per round.

EViJHho1D7U93moQ.name: Smoke Vision
EViJHho1D7U93moQ.description: Smoke doesn't impair a brimorak's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

E06rANySjyXiIjDH.name: Boiling Blood
E06rANySjyXiIjDH.description: Each time an adjacent creature deals slashing or piercing damage to the brimorak, the attacker is sprayed with the brimorak's boiling blood, which deals @Damage[2d4[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save).

Bh4tXIFDTCdh3Vzs.name: Breath Weapon
Bh4tXIFDTCdh3Vzs.description:
The brimorak spits their boiling blood in a @Template[line|distance:20] that deals @Damage[6d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic|options:area-effect] save). The brimorak can't use their Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

The ground within this area becomes slippery, with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease} spell targeting an area until it's cleaned up or the brimorak is able to use their Breath Weapon again, whichever comes first.

VRhuQIGcrHKCOyL4.name: Flaming Weapon
VRhuQIGcrHKCOyL4.description:
A brimorak's hooves and any weapon they wield burst into flame, dealing an extra 1d6 fire damage with each hit.

If they don't have a weapon, they can create a flaming sword of fire and steel (see flaming sword Strike in Melee entry above).

GdnX1i87yKmvFsjB.name: Fume
GdnX1i87yKmvFsjB.description:
The brimorak emits a cloud of thick black smoke in a @Template[burst|distance:10] that remains in place for [[/gmr 1d4 #Duration Fume]]{1d4 rounds}.

All creatures within the smoke become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the smoke become concealed to creatures within it. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the smoke it must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

Alystair Caskwater (1-2).name: Alystair Caskwater (1-2)
Alystair Caskwater (1-2).description:
Risen corpses of sailors who died at sea, draugr reek of the rot and decay of the briny deep. Their eyes glow with ghastly green light, and rotting seaweed, barnacles, and dead sea creatures cling to their bodies. Draugr can't speak, but expresses their malicious emotions with gurgles, as though they were eternally drowning with lungs full of water. They desire little more than to attack living creatures, especially those who sail the sea. Even when they go upon land, draugrs often drag the corpses of those they strike down back to the water, populating the depths with even more dead.

Draugr rise in the haunted places of the sea, where restless spirits, swells of void energy, or supernatural storms deliver death. A corpse might rest at the bottom of the sea for some time before awakening as a draugr. Collecting detritus and organisms, a corpse becomes increasingly disgusting before it finally rises. Proximity to intelligent life can expedite this process, and an underwater explorer who happens upon a shipwreck might cause a body to snap to unlife as a draugr suddenly. The creatures don't take intrusions lightly, especially upon their place of death.

Though steeped in evil, draugr are susceptible to reminders of their lives as mariners. In particular, a well-performed sea shanty or call-and-response work song might cause a draugr to become lost in reverie for a moment. The creatures have even been witnessed moaning along, unable to sing the words but providing haunting accompaniment. The lull rarely lasts long, though, as the beauty of the song quickly becomes a reminder of the tragedy that befell the draugr, reaffirming their desire for blood and death.

More powerful draugr with burning red eyes are called draugr captains. They're 3rd-level creatures with elite adjustments that can cast obscuring mist as an innate divine spell three times per day.

Qs8JZrELvc5vMsxP.name: The Void's Revenge
Qs8JZrELvc5vMsxP.description: A creature that slays Alystair is subjected to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{Mariner's Curse} spell with a @Check[will|dc:17|traits:spell] save. The curse ends if the draugr is buried in a calm sea or after 1 week passes.

cjYLiElA3muRcJuo.name: Grotesque Gift
cjYLiElA3muRcJuo.description: Alystair's attacks spatter their targets with rancid flesh and rotting seaweed. A creature damaged by a draugr's Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:15] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

bS27ihuZ0Xs3mU7a.name: Swipe
bS27ihuZ0Xs3mU7a.description: Alystair Caskwater makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within its melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A Swipe counts as two attacks for the draugr's multiple attack penalty.

zMkrKhyfRWFrFfuv.name: Fanatical Frenzy
zMkrKhyfRWFrFfuv.description:
Requirements The cultist has taken damage and is neither @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} nor already in a frenzy

Effect The cultist flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the cultist gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls, and they take a -2 status penalty to AC. The cultist can't voluntarily stop their frenzy. After their frenzy, the cultist is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.3Wtzyb0ZgkaC7vHY]{Effect: Fanatical Frenzy}

NxUxmAIDF9KFfzeg.name: Demon-Touched Weapon
NxUxmAIDF9KFfzeg.description:
Frequency once per turn

Requirements Shenga's most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip spell

Effect Until the end of her next turn, Shenga deals 1d6 bleed damage with her melee Strikes.

4fcC2OIQJILiud6I.name: Reach Spell
4fcC2OIQJILiud6I.description: If the next action the Shenga Heartrender uses is to Cast a Spell that has a range, increase that spell's range by 30 feet.

Y6Gy3tHtrZry8mhp.name: Hydration
Y6Gy3tHtrZry8mhp.description: Azarketi must regularly submerge themselves in water to rehydrate their water-acclimated skin. After the first 24 hours outside of water, they gain a –1 status penalty to Fortitude saves as their skin cracks and their gills become painful. After 48 hours, they struggle to breathe air and begin to suffocate until returned to water.

pbwXaaeC2q0N1edB.name: Submerged Stealth
pbwXaaeC2q0N1edB.description: While submerged in water, an azarketi ruffian gains a +2 circumstance bonus on their Stealth check, indicated above.

Void Zombie Explorer.name: Void Zombie Explorer
Void Zombie Explorer.description:
A void zombie arises when a humanoid dies from an akata's void death affliction. This walking corpse is animated by a larval akata attached to the deceased creature's brain, using a grotesque feeding tendril that emerges from the corpse's mouth to drink blood from its victims.

A void zombie typically exists for only a few months before it collapses and the larval akata crawls free from the motionless shell. When it feels the natural end of its unlife approaching, a void zombie finds a secluded place to vomit forth the nearly mature akata larva, then withers away. The disgorged larva metamorphizes into a full-grown akata several hours later, usually eating the corpse as its first meal.

The name "void zombie" is something of a misnomer; though still compelled by necromantic energies, a void zombie is a host in the life cycle of a parasitic alien, not a mindless, reanimated corpse (despite their similar appearances). The fact that a typical void zombie shares the neutral alignment of the larval akata within, rather than the intrinsically evil nature of other zombies, has caused some scholars to push to reclassify them under other names. Suggestions have included "void dead," "akata spawn," or "bloodwalker," but the visceral and compelling commonplace name has proven difficult to shed.

The driving force behind a void zombie's violence rises from the ravenous hunger of the alien parasite that serves as the channel for its animating negative energies. Necromancers have tried often to duplicate the void zombie, but without a larval akata hosted within, the result is simply a zombie with missing jaws or, at best, one that moves faster than normal. Others have compared a captive void zombie to a captive yellow musk thrall in an attempt to discover a potential link between the two- after all, both are animated bodies controlled by a parasitic outside force. Strangely, a void zombie becomes particularly violent when encountering a yellow musk thrall, making direct comparisons of the two creatures particularly difficult, or even dangerous. The fact that a void zombie, unlike a yellow musk thrall, is actually undead may hold some clues as to the source of this strange behavior.

mdEZdShzE63nlTQK.name: Salt Water Vulnerability
mdEZdShzE63nlTQK.description: Salt water acts as an extremely strong acid on the larval akata inside the void zombie. Full immersion in salt water deals @Damage[4d6[acid]] damage per round. On any round in which the void zombie takes damage due to its salt water weakness, the larval akata retreats to the depths of the void zombie's body, causing the void zombie to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn.

19Ayra6rX2M49iPG.name: Blood Drain
19Ayra6rX2M49iPG.description:
Requirements The void zombie's previous action was a successful feeding tendril Strike against the target creature.

Effect The void zombie uses its feeding tendril to drain blood from the creature it has struck. This deals @Damage[2d4[bleed]] damage, and a creature that takes this damage is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing (of any kind or amount).

Cosmic Amoeba.name: Cosmic Amoeba
Cosmic Amoeba.description: These blobs of nearly transparent protoplasm are identical in form and behavior to the microscopic creatures from which they have evolved, except their outlandish size makes them all the more dangerous. Unlike slimes, puddings, and other deadly oozes, giant amoebas have an outer membrane that contains their internal structures, making them more susceptible to slashing weapons than their amorphous kin. However, this membrane is also extremely flexible and permeable, allowing them to surround prey and absorb it, suffocating and slowly digesting it in the amoeba's acidic fluids.

N9in8b8yuAVDLoyD.name: Motion Sense
N9in8b8yuAVDLoyD.description: A cosmic amoeba can sense nearby creatures through vibration and air or water movement.

XtvjYpzQo45Gb7nt.name: No Breath
XtvjYpzQo45Gb7nt.description: The cosmic amoeba doesn't breathe and is immune to effects that require breathing (such as inhaled poison).

aQDe7We9BV7qqiIm.name: Envelop
aQDe7We9BV7qqiIm.description:
Requirements The cosmic amoeba begins its turn with a target its size or smaller @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The cosmic amoeba maintains the Grab and extends pseudopods to surround the creature and pull it inside the amoeba's body. This thereafter has the same effect as if the amoeba had @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.zU3Ovaet4xQ5Gmvy]{Engulfed} the creature (@Check[reflex|dc:17], @Damage[1d6[acid]], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 17, Rupture 3).

eQGUATVlHv8iZ97x.name: Weak Acid
eQGUATVlHv8iZ97x.description: A cosmic amoeba's acid damages only organic material—not metal, stone, or other inorganic substances.

KtD1ynKI4uZ3aaVz.name: Faceglomph
KtD1ynKI4uZ3aaVz.description:
Trigger The sharktopus eidolon makes a successful tentacle strike

Effect the sharktopus makes an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}. If it is successful, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until it escapes.

U7f8VRoMyvjnggZ5.name: Deflecting Gale
U7f8VRoMyvjnggZ5.description:
Trigger Zibini is the target of a physical ranged attack

Requirements Zibini is aware of the attack

Effect A swift gale whips up between Zibini and the source of the ranged attack, giving Zibini a +2 status bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, the wind deflected it. The wind can't deflect unusually large or heavy ranged projectiles (such as boulders or ballista bolts).

SAtpKgmTx69OzW4c.name: Sacred Fire
SAtpKgmTx69OzW4c.description: Any non-consumable weapon the cultist wields gains the effects of the flaming rune in addition to a +1 weapon rune.

lHDqGv47kle2wdUY.name: Sacred Sabotage
lHDqGv47kle2wdUY.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The cultist of Sezelrian can draw a poison and quickly apply it to the weapon or unarmed attack of an adjacent ally.

Busoborn Akata.name: Busoborn Akata
Busoborn Akata.description:
An akata is a hairless, blue-skinned quadruped with fearsome jaws, glowing eyes, a pair of thin tails, and a mane of writhing tentacles. It is a strangely silent beast, as it lacks the lungs and vocal chords necessary to vocalize. It also lacks ears, but it has heightened visual and olfactory senses.

When food is scarce, an akata secretes a resin from its pores that forms into a sturdy cocoon of pale green crystal-the skymetal noqual. An akata can hibernate in this cocoon without needing to eat or drink for centuries, though it retains a rudimentary sense of its surroundings and can break out in only a few minutes' time. These cocoons allow the creatures to travel through the void of space, seeking new worlds where they can infect suitable humanoid hosts with their larval young. Once a victim succumbs to this infection, the offspring fight among themselves until one proves the strongest. The surviving akata then animates the corpse-now a void zombie-which shambles about of its own accord.

sYzEwjtXD4GsP03b.name: Hibernation
sYzEwjtXD4GsP03b.description: After 3 or more days without eating, an akata can secrete resin that encases it in a noqual cocoon. The cocoon has Hardness 9, 40 HP, and a Broken Threshold of 18. It has resistance 5 to damage from magical sources. As long as the cocoon remains intact, the akata can't be harmed, and it doesn't need to eat or drink. While inside the cocoon, the akata gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.sebk9XseMCRkDqRg]{Lifesense} 30 feet. The akata remains in a state of hibernation until it is exposed to extreme heat or senses a living creature, at which point it can burst free of its cocoon in [[/gmr 1d4 #minutes]]{1d4 minutes}.

rsf1q6ooMNJFjdfh.name: No Hearing
rsf1q6ooMNJFjdfh.description: An akata has no auditory senses. It is immune to auditory effects, automatically critically fails Perception checks that require it to hear, and takes a -2 status penalty to Perception checks (but not initiative rolls) that involve sound but also rely on other senses.

JpMbqfC586ivpVKz.name: Bark Shield
JpMbqfC586ivpVKz.description:
Trigger The busoborn akata takes damage that isn't fire

Effect The akata hardens its body into a bark-like material at the point of impact and reduces the damage it takes by 5.

D13sjvjuSrxFEe35.name: No Breath
D13sjvjuSrxFEe35.description: An akata doesn't breathe and is immune to effects that require breathing (such as an inhaled poison).

AMnTAvqDDSvhK4rN.name: Salt Water Vulnerability
AMnTAvqDDSvhK4rN.description: Salt water acts as an extremely strong acid to an akata. A splash of salt water deals @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage to an akata, and damaging salt water effects deal 1d6 additional damage. Full immersion in salt water deals @Damage[4d6[acid]] damage per round.

LZvNqSbvs39SwzSQ.name: Grasping Tendrils
LZvNqSbvs39SwzSQ.description:
The busoborn akata presses one of its tentacle vines to the ground and causes it to spread beneath creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:15] in front of it. Until the end of its next turn, the area is difficult terrain to enemy creatures, and the akata gains a +2 circumstance bonus to attack rolls against targets within that area

Special The akata can only use this ability if it has no more than one creature grappled.

Kxaya5FoNcZYStg7.name: Pack Attack
Kxaya5FoNcZYStg7.description: The busoborn akata's Strikes deal an additional 1d8 damage to creatures within reach of at least two of its allies.

L17R2FDChGWE5pgD.name: Void Death
L17R2FDChGWE5pgD.description:
An akata implants its parasitic larval young into any creature it bites, but only Medium or Small humanoids make suitable hosts; all other creatures are immune to this disease

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:17]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect 1 (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 drained 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead and corpse rises as a void zombie in [[/br 2d4 #hours]]{2d4 hours}

Enraged Shurrizih.name: Enraged Shurrizih
Enraged Shurrizih.description: Regarded as the progenitors of geniekind, janns hold a position of esteem above the genies tied to specific planes. They possess an inborn ability to grant wishes, which the other branches of geniekind lack and greatly envy. Nomadic jann shuyookhs rarely hold court, preferring to gather only when the need arises to perform great deeds. Lesser janns respect and venerate these leaders for their wisdom and total dedication to preserving the honor and reputation of their people. A jann shuyookh reads portents and omens when dealing with duplicitous mortals.

3LJ5loWR0ewNBTdA.name: Commanding Presence
3LJ5loWR0ewNBTdA.description:
20 feet.

A creature that enters the aura must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:19] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure), and is then temporarily immune for 1 minute. A genie (with the exception of another jann) takes a –4 circumstance penalty to their save.

pZqtLVdHTC8R8sRI.name: Elemental Resistance
pZqtLVdHTC8R8sRI.description: The jann shuyookh's elemental resistance applies to cold, electricity, and fire damage, as well as all damage from elemental sources (including environmental damage from the elemental planes and damage from anything with the air, earth, fire, metal, water, or wood trait).

Sp1wwUYNjUeg1sgS.name: All Made One
Sp1wwUYNjUeg1sgS.description:
The jann shuyookh calls upon all the elements that make up their being and chooses one. They gain an additional arcane spell they can cast at will and empower their Strikes with the element, dealing an extra 1d6 damage of the listed type. These benefits last until the shuyookh uses this ability again.

  • Air: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9AAkVUCwF6WVNNY2]{Lightning Bolt}, 1d6 electricity;
  • Earth: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vh1RpbWfqdNC4L3P]{One with Stone}, 1d6 bludgeoning;
  • Fire: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball}, 1d6 fire;
  • Metal: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.3A3ueS9Q0s3U8KXE]{Noxious Metals}, 1d6 electricity;
  • Water: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LNOwaJAkCfsgTKgV]{Wall of Water}, 1d6 bludgeoning;
  • Wood: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KsWhliKfUs3IpW3c]{Wall of Thorns}, 1d6 piercing.

yibXjLPFTeJxtcIx.name: Change Shape
yibXjLPFTeJxtcIx.description:
The jann transforms into a Small or Medium elemental or animal. This doesn't affect the gennayn's statistics, but it could change the damage type of their Strikes.

JiRJrLMiR5mFr2z2.name: Sneak Attack
JiRJrLMiR5mFr2z2.description: The creature's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

J5WIMcWCB5zwrJaU.name: Change Shape
J5WIMcWCB5zwrJaU.description:
The tanuki can transform into a mundane raccoon dog, using the statistics of pest form. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The tanuki loses any unarmed Strikes they gained from a tanuki heritage or ancestry feat in this form. The tanuki can remain in the raccoon dog form indefinitely, and can shift back to the tanuki form by using this action again.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

9qvkUiI475s7t3wW.description:

aUJAYN4u00MuN0hv.name: Flurry of Blows (Tonta Only)
aUJAYN4u00MuN0hv.description:

6Hx2e6dtLEA5BDHt.name: Breath Pollen
6Hx2e6dtLEA5BDHt.description: The wood scamp breathes choking pollen in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic]; creatures who don't need to breathe are immune). The wood scamp can't use Breathe Pollen again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breathe Pollen]]{1d4 rounds}.

XHAXoj6m7QTtPhU6.name: Thorn Puncture
XHAXoj6m7QTtPhU6.description: The wood scamp breaks off one of its thornlike claws in the target's skin, dealing @Damage[1[bleed]]{1 persistent bleed} damage until the thorn is removed, which requires an Interact action. This damage is cumulative with each thorn caught in a creature's skin.

Mutant Cryptid Pine Pangolin.name: Mutant Cryptid Pine Pangolin
Mutant Cryptid Pine Pangolin.description: These creatures sleep while hanging upside down by their partially curled tails and rely on their thick wooden scales to protect them from danger. One such danger the scales negate is the falling damage from deliberately rolling up and dropping onto the head of an unsuspecting opponent, which is one of their favorite combat strategies. Beneath their scales, pine pangolin bodies secrete a thick, sticky tar that serves as a secondary line of defense.

JysGjLVn8IglxjMg.name: Explosive End
JysGjLVn8IglxjMg.description: The mutant pangolin's death reveals one last surprise as it explodes into splinters. When it dies, it explodes, dealing @Damage[4d6[piercing]] damage to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10], with a basic @Check[reflex|dc:26] save.

RdcTBXUDcOhG6Cjy.name: Roll Up
RdcTBXUDcOhG6Cjy.description: The mutant pine pangolin falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, closes up its scales, and rolls into a ball. While Rolled Up, the pangolin gains resistance 10 to physical damage and total immunity to falling damage from heights of 50 feet or less. The only action the pine pangolin can take is to Stand, and the effects of Roll Up end once the pangolin Stands.

dyvB5o0Y6YxRtDwR.name: Secrete Tar
dyvB5o0Y6YxRtDwR.description: The mutant pine pangolin secretes a brown, sticky tar within a @Template[emanation|distance:5], making those squares difficult terrain for 1 minute. Each creature that enters or starts its turn in a tarred square must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it Escapes. On a critical failure, the creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}; prone creatures take a –2 circumstance penalty to their checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} the tar. The pine pangolin is immune to the effects of its own tar.

JfPjwX49dzOuqGpA.name: Shifting Iridescence
JfPjwX49dzOuqGpA.description: Whenever the mutant pine pangolin takes energy damage to which it isn't resistant or immune, after taking the damage normally, it gains resistance 5 to that damage type. If it had a resistance to a different damage type from shifting iridescence, it replaces the old resistance with the new resistance.

9v7ZNEaolnaC9N1v.name: Unusual Bane
9v7ZNEaolnaC9N1v.description: This mutant pine pangolin is traumatized by the former Conference Z staff who teamed up to hold it down while experimenting on it. The first time each round the mutant pine pangolin comes within 15 feet of any character who took the Aid action, or is attacked while being flanked by two characters, it takes @Damage[8[mental]] damage and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save. On a failure, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure).

Steadied Dohv-Dranna.name: Steadied Dohv-Dranna
Steadied Dohv-Dranna.description:
The grotesque brain collectors originate from worlds far beyond the known solar system, and are part of a conglomeration of hostile aliens known collectively as the Dominion of the Black. Whether driven by their own schemes or directives from sinister overlords, brain collectors arrive in living starships to harvest the brains of intelligent creatures. These aberrations draw no nutrition from brains, instead storing them for analysis and as vessels for occult magical energies.

A brain collector's form evokes that of a tailless scorpion, but the pulsing brain-filled blisters that glisten along its back make them impossible to mistake for merely oversized arachnids. Baleful eyes glare from the joints on their legs, and the unsettling, intrusive whisper-thoughts they telepathically broadcast into the minds of those they seek to feed on can be interpreted as threats or promises alike.

Brain collectors have very little empathy for the denizens of any world they visit, despite the fact that certain cults venerate them, or the Dominion they hail from, as if they were gods. To brain collectors, terrestrial creatures are simply resources for their magical needs and occult powers. They have little interest in worshipping gods or being worshipped themselves, yet they do practice strange forms of religion of their own, in which they consider the primordial forces of deep space as worthy of faith and fear.

EMWzNZneWpK3nLER.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

9SCUupqh4itf7aTx.name: Brain Blisters
9SCUupqh4itf7aTx.description: A brain collector has seven brain blisters on its back that it uses to house stolen brains. A brain collector without all seven blisters full is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied} with a value equal to the number of empty blisters.

SE3QsBzRX2bmkrnR.name: Brain Loss
SE3QsBzRX2bmkrnR.description: If a brain collector takes 30 damage from a critical hit or takes 25 mental damage, it must succeed at a DC 29 save (@Check[fortitude|dc:29] for critical damage or @Check[will|dc:29] for mental damage) or one of its brain blisters is destroyed.

a8yy3kqZmWzMBKci.name: Brain Collector Venom
a8yy3kqZmWzMBKci.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:29]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage, enfeebled 1, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

mvKy4fox7C9GJNq4.name: Collect Brain
mvKy4fox7C9GJNq4.description: The brain collector collects a brain of a creature that has been dead for no more than 1 minute. It can then use an Interact action to secure the brain in one of its empty brain blisters.

thChQrAoqxPJlmhv.name: Explosive End
thChQrAoqxPJlmhv.description: The mutant brain collector's death reveals one last surprise as it explodes into radioactive ash. When it dies, it explodes, dealing @Damage[5d6[acid]] damage to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10], with a basic @Check[reflex|dc:27] save.

ttZHm74xhLp5A9SV.name: Shifting Iridescence

If it had a resistance to a different damage type from shifting iridescence, it replaces the old resistance with the new resistance.

wWg5kX5kajT5aBWq.name: Sneak Attack

Os9rLFt5Hr2fNpo4.name: Surprise Attack
Os9rLFt5Hr2fNpo4.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the Sronwa.

LIOgShfbhNdwNGYC.name: Infused Items
LIOgShfbhNdwNGYC.description: An assassins' guild grenadier carries 2 infused @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Acid Flask (Moderate)}, 2 infused @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)}, and 2 infused @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.nVvH1ZcM7OwIVIs8]{Frost Vial (Moderate)}. These items last for 24 hours, or until the next time they make their daily preparations.

2B0KODcNQmk0kwWw.name: Far Lob
2B0KODcNQmk0kwWw.description: The grenadier's bombs have a range increment of 30 feet (instead of 20 feet).

cHuWxUHj0duLEbPi.name: Quick Bomber
cHuWxUHj0duLEbPi.description: The grenadier draws an alchemical bomb with an Interact action and throws it as a ranged Strike.

pF8t6LXhHkENZoDo.name: Envenom
pF8t6LXhHkENZoDo.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Using either saliva or blood, the infiltrator applies vishkanyan venom to one weapon they're holding. To use their blood, they must be injured, or they can deal themselves @Damage[1[slashing]] damage as part of the action.

XMIlPOepvvLyrBEY.name: Flexible
XMIlPOepvvLyrBEY.description: The infiltrator is adept at dealing with tight situations. They have a +1 circumstance bonus to checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.

rcmZxZWjzhdTMOqY.name: Proficient Poisoner
rcmZxZWjzhdTMOqY.description: The infiltrator doesn't lose the poison on a weapon due to a critically failed Strike.

hXOjARDmyTzi0Tem.name: Sneak Attack

qvkDrwwdl5VMKuJL.description: The locust knight's exoskeleton functions as heavy armor but has no speed penalty.

The locust knight can't use this ability again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge this ability]]{1d4 rounds}.

mOemXUbjPGAfM91K.name: Lunge
mOemXUbjPGAfM91K.description: The locust knight makes a Strike with their rotcarver scythe, increasing their reach by 5 feet for that Strike. They can choose to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} their opponent instead of making a Strike.

Vengeful Alystair Caskwater (3-4).name: Vengeful Alystair Caskwater (3-4)
Vengeful Alystair Caskwater (3-4).description:
Risen corpses of sailors who died at sea, draugr reek of the rot and decay of the briny deep. Their eyes glow with ghastly green light, and rotting seaweed, barnacles, and dead sea creatures cling to their bodies. Draugr can't speak, but expresses their malicious emotions with gurgles, as though they were eternally drowning with lungs full of water. They desire little more than to attack living creatures, especially those who sail the sea. Even when they go upon land, draugrs often drag the corpses of those they strike down back to the water, populating the depths with even more dead.

Draugr rise in the haunted places of the sea, where restless spirits, swells of void energy, or supernatural storms deliver death. A corpse might rest at the bottom of the sea for some time before awakening as a draugr. Collecting detritus and organisms, a corpse becomes increasingly disgusting before it finally rises. Proximity to intelligent life can expedite this process, and an underwater explorer who happens upon a shipwreck might cause a body to snap to unlife as a draugr suddenly. The creatures don't take intrusions lightly, especially upon their place of death.

Though steeped in evil, draugr are susceptible to reminders of their lives as mariners. In particular, a well-performed sea shanty or call-and-response work song might cause a draugr to become lost in reverie for a moment. The creatures have even been witnessed moaning along, unable to sing the words but providing haunting accompaniment. The lull rarely lasts long, though, as the beauty of the song quickly becomes a reminder of the tragedy that befell the draugr, reaffirming their desire for blood and death.

More powerful draugr with burning red eyes are called draugr captains. They're 3rd-level creatures with elite adjustments that can cast obscuring mist as an innate divine spell three times per day.

Qs8JZrELvc5vMsxP.name: The Void's Revenge
Qs8JZrELvc5vMsxP.description: A creature that slays Alystair is subjected to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{Mariner's Curse} spell with a @Check[will|dc:22|traits:spell] save. The curse ends if the draugr is buried in a calm sea or after 1 week passes.

cjYLiElA3muRcJuo.name: Grotesque Gift
cjYLiElA3muRcJuo.description: Alystair's attacks spatter their targets with rancid flesh and rotting seaweed. A creature damaged by a draugr's Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

bS27ihuZ0Xs3mU7a.name: Swipe
bS27ihuZ0Xs3mU7a.description: Alystair Caskwater makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within its melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A Swipe counts as two attacks for the draugr's multiple attack penalty.

VQNPHotvY6aogCDS.name: Slip from the Back
VQNPHotvY6aogCDS.description: Firmagor directs his gang members to concentrate their actions to defend him. Until the start of his next turn, when an attack against Firmagor misses, Firmagor or another friendly creature within 30 feet may use their reaction to Stride.

wvIJZGXRhWF8vzyG.name: Sneaky Cast
wvIJZGXRhWF8vzyG.description: Foes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Firmagor take a –2 circumstance penalty on their saving throws against his spells.

kSd8rIlnXiVczYg0.name: Deny Advantage
kSd8rIlnXiVczYg0.description: Krosovahn Mendesil isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 7th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using surprise attack.

Ht7knXtXeyTkKi2n.name: Evasion
Ht7knXtXeyTkKi2n.description: When Krosovahn Mendesil rolls a success on a Reflex save, he gets a critical success instead.

qNEPB3RKC3SlV4YE.name: Surprise Attack
qNEPB3RKC3SlV4YE.description: On the first round of combat, if Krosovahn Mendesil rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures who haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Krosovahn Mendesil.

b4eGXoRWpidh8A9B.name: You're Next
b4eGXoRWpidh8A9B.description:
Trigger Krosovahn Mendesil reduces an enemy to 0 Hit Points

Effect After downing the foe, Krosovahn Mendesil menacingly reminds another foe that he's coming after them next. Krosovahn Mendesil attempts an Intimidation check with a +2 circumstance bonus to [[/act demoralize options=youre-next]] a single creature that he can see and that can see him.

wXgvnztT7r9jO7Px.name: Brutal Rally
wXgvnztT7r9jO7Px.description:
Trigger Krosovahn Mendesil rolls a critical hit against a creature

Effect All allies that can see Krosovahn Mendesil gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls until the start of Krosovahn Mendesil's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7x0O2GqWBJiAk5PF]{Effect: Brutal Rally}

dlhm2yJ4EUGym0CG.name: Gang Up
dlhm2yJ4EUGym0CG.description: Any enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against Krosovahn Mendesil's melee attacks due to flanking as long as the enemy is within melee reach of both Krosovahn and one of his allies.

PDidp7qMSw5qRoXU.name: Quick Draw
PDidp7qMSw5qRoXU.description: Krosovahn Mendesil Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.

j1wf4dSXkGypJjRs.name: Sneak Attack

TgG7cxe4YnSkKy80.name: Functional Form
TgG7cxe4YnSkKy80.description:
Depending on the creature it resembles, the topiary beast gains additional abilities.

Ape The branch Strike is agile, has reach 10 feet, and deals bludgeoning damage instead of piercing damage.

Boar The topiary beast gains the Ferocity reaction.

Cobra The beast gains the Attack of Opportunity reaction.

CO77haYWzPv7DrJ3.name: Intimidating Display
CO77haYWzPv7DrJ3.description: When using Intimidation to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} a target, a topiary beast doesn't take a penalty for not speaking the same language as the target.

NH0TpzJs66dQssIc.name: Beast Training
NH0TpzJs66dQssIc.description: Whenever a beastmaster cultist and one of their animal allies are adjacent to the same foe, they both count as flanking that foe regardless of their actual positions.

aO7x4vt7Pe9o3zNp.name: Enraging Whistle
aO7x4vt7Pe9o3zNp.description:
The beastmaster cultist blows on her divine whistle, riling up the nearby beasts, granting a +1 status bonus to attacks and damage to all allied animals within 60 feet for one round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.DPN3d9EZM9XqktWT]{Effect: Enraging Whistle}

Weak Leaf Leshy (Q19).name: Weak Leaf Leshy (Q19)
Weak Leaf Leshy (Q19).description:
Leaf leshys are diminutive protectors of forests clad in pine cone armor and hats of fruit, flowers, or leaves. They enjoy mock battles but act cautiously in real ones.

Leshys are intelligent plant creatures that guard areas of primeval wilderness or earthly power. Originally created by powerful fey, they manifest when a skilled practitioner of primal magic-typically a druid-combines a nature spirit with a body carefully grown from local vegetation. The rites and materials required to create a leshy vary depending on the type of leshy. They are typically given life in an area of great natural significance, such as an arboreal's grove, a druidic circle, a fairy ring, or a great natural wonder.

J8d6vqQrqGXi53bU.name: Verdant Burst
J8d6vqQrqGXi53bU.description: When a leaf leshy dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from its body, restoring @Damage[1d4[healing]] Hit Points to each plant creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. This area is filled with tree saplings, becoming difficult terrain. If the terrain is not a viable environment for these trees, they wither after 24 hours.

LqM7JU0cOL7itoch.name: Change Shape
LqM7JU0cOL7itoch.description:
The leaf leshy transforms into a Small tree. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

WPtFVQLHQ2T2WxY7.name: Deafening Blow
WPtFVQLHQ2T2WxY7.description:
When a leaf leshy hits with its seedpod Strike, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:14] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute.

4vfOgL2x3vJgpsBu.name: Glide
4vfOgL2x3vJgpsBu.description: The leshy glides gently through the air, moving 5 feet toward the ground and up to 25 feet forward. As long as the leshy spends at least 1 action gliding each round, it remains in the air at the end of each turn. For the purpose of determining damage from falls, a leaf leshy always treats falls as if they were 20 feet shorter.

fom3tH9ATguJfWY8.name: +2 Status to Fortitude Saves vs. Poison

S4c8U06RdigWWdmW.name: Psi Amps
S4c8U06RdigWWdmW.description:
Tisbah can cast psi cantrips as amped cantrips by using one focus point and making the following alterations:

Mage Hand: Tisbah targets a creature of Medium size or smaller and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} them with a spell attack roll against their Fortitude DC. The first time each round Tisbah Sustains this Spell, she can attempt to Shove the creature again. The target takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until the spell ends.

Telekinetic Projectile: Tisbah increases the damage of this cantrip by [[/r 2d6]]. On a successful Strike, she pushes the target 5 feet away, or 10 feet away on a critical success.

Telekinetic Rend: Tisbah changes the cantrip's damage to 1d6 bludgeoning and 1d6 slashing. A creature that critically fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

xcGTw6cnbLAaJb6P.name: Psychic Practice
xcGTw6cnbLAaJb6P.description: Tisbah's range for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.60sgbuMWN0268dB7]{Telekinetic Projectile} increases to 60 feet.

CmwiPb08oJWmU5NE.description:
Trigger Tisbah's starts her turn with half or less Hit Points remaining

Effect Tisbah is surrounded by a swirl of psychic energy that effortlessly moves small objects around her. She deals @Damage[2d6[force]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:20] (@Check[reflex|dc:21] save) and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. She gains a +4 status bonus to damage when casting telekinetic projectile or telekinetic rend. This effect remains for 2 rounds or until Tisbah is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, whichever comes first.

mOemXUbjPGAfM91K.name: Lunge
mOemXUbjPGAfM91K.description: The locust knight makes a Strike with their rotcarver scythe, increasing their reach by 5 feet for that Strike. They can choose to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} their opponent instead of making a Strike.

Elite Lively Commodore Sticky Fingers.name: Elite Lively Commodore Sticky Fingers
Elite Lively Commodore Sticky Fingers.description:
The mischievous dragon sprites called draxies have dueled their pixie cousins for the title of ultimate prankster for centuries. They exercise patience and planning to create the perfect pranks, spending months, or even years, on their efforts. One exception to their flighty nature is the elucrea, a lifelong bond between a draxie and a creature they're particularly fond of, typically one with a good sense of humor. According to draxie legend, a little piece of a draxie's spirit remembers being united as the ancient fey dragonet Elucredassa, and that causes draxies to yearn for such connections with others.

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary, all sprites share a connection to magic and a diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.

5eqtzIqWpDscyCIh.name: Breath Weapon
5eqtzIqWpDscyCIh.description:
The draxie breathes pixie dust in a @Template[cone|distance:15], with a random effect determined each time they use their Breath Weapon. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the effect. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:19] save or be affected.

The draxie can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

  1. The target takes the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} spell.
  2. The target loses its last 5 minutes of memory.
  3. The target takes the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep} spell.
  4. For 1 minute, the target is in a state of euphoria that makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

sgn97FWn1ncH55JV.name: Fire Crossbows!
sgn97FWn1ncH55JV.description: The mercenary squad members draw or reload their crossbows, then launch a ranged attack in the form of a volley. This volley is a @Template[burst|distance:10] within 80 feet that deals @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save). When the mercenary squad is reduced to 8 or fewer squares, this area decreases to a @Template[burst|distance:5].

DzuUUmbM8O50g566.name: Get 'em!
DzuUUmbM8O50g566.description:
1 to 3

Frequency once per round

Effect The mercenary squad engages in a coordinated melee attack against each adjacent enemy, with a @Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8)[bludgeoning]] damage

2 @Damage[(1d8+6)[bludgeoning]] damage

3 @Damage[(1d8+9)[bludgeoning]] damage

TN5eD7xA7j3IgV5g.name: Troop Movement
TN5eD7xA7j3IgV5g.description:
Whenever the city guards Stride, they first Form Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20- foot area (minus any missing squares), then move up to their Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the guards enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to all the guards.

The mercenary squad ignores difficult terrain (but not greater difficult terrain) caused by crowds or from movement through narrow spaces such as alleyways.

NH0TpzJs66dQssIc.name: Beast Training
NH0TpzJs66dQssIc.description: Whenever a beastmaster cultist and one of their animal allies are adjacent to the same foe, they both count as flanking that foe regardless of their actual positions.

aO7x4vt7Pe9o3zNp.name: Enraging Whistle
aO7x4vt7Pe9o3zNp.description:
The beastmaster cultist blows on her divine whistle, riling up the nearby beasts, granting a +1 status bonus to attacks and damage to all allied animals within 60 feet for one round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.DPN3d9EZM9XqktWT]{Effect: Enraging Whistle}

Barnacle Barnaby (5-6).name: Barnacle Barnaby (5-6)
Barnacle Barnaby (5-6).description:
Feared by mariners and coastal dwellers everywhere, the aquatic ghouls known as lacedons are said to be the spawn of an ancient crew of sailors who became lost at sea and were forced to resort to cannibalism to survive. Their appearance is the stuff of a diver's nightmare, supplementing the vicious traits of their land-bound kin with spines, fins, and wide mouths bristling with needle-sharp teeth like piscine predators of the nethermost ocean depths.

Devious and cunning, ghouls can be found anywhere corpses are laid to rest, forever seeking to satisfy their boundless craving for humanoid flesh.

vkuk04wj4sfihq3b.name: Corpse Scent (Imprecise) 1 mile
vkuk04wj4sfihq3b.description: The lacedon can smell humanoid corpses in the water from up to 1 mile away.

Uc4DijFU9ApvpWFZ.name: Consume Flesh
Uc4DijFU9ApvpWFZ.description:
Requirements The lacedon is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The lacedon devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[3d6[healing]] Hit Points. It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

MYPGBIYRPHho61zG.name: Ghoul Fever
MYPGBIYRPHho61zG.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

dtbhcid8fzmfjtp7.name: Paralyzing Spew
dtbhcid8fzmfjtp7.description: The lacedon discharges a spray of carrion vomit at a creature within 20 feet, dealing @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:19|basic]. A non-elf creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save to end the paralysis at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save. The lacedon can't use Paralyzing Spew again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Paralyzing Spew]]{1d4 rounds}.

Omertius, The Engorged.name: Omertius, The Engorged
Omertius, The Engorged.description: For most demons, possessing a creature requires a ritual, magic item, or condition, but for invidiaks, who lack a body, possession is akin to donning a suit of clothing. Known also as shadow demons, invidiaks are formed from envious mortal souls.

qRpjdfZvdGYi248g.name: Blood Possession
qRpjdfZvdGYi248g.description:
Omertius sends himself into his target's blood, controlling them as if af ected by the spell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession}. The target attempts a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] check. Omertius can Dismiss the spell at any time.

Critical Success The target is unafected.

Success Omertius possesses the target but can't control it.

Failure Omertius possesses the target and takes partial control. He no longer has a separate turn; instead, he might control the target. At the start of each of the target's turns, it attempts another Will save. If it fails, it's controlled by Omertius on that turn; if it succeeds, it chooses its own actions; and if it critically succeeds, it forces him out and the spell ends.

Critical Failure Omertius possesses the target fully, and the target can only watch as he manipulates it like a puppet. The target is controlled by Omertius.

tmzjCUUMHKEmtqEy.name: Living Visage
tmzjCUUMHKEmtqEy.description: While she has more than 30 HP, 287's appears to be a living creature. She has an automatic result of 34 on Deception checks and DCs to conceal her undead status and can Feed on the Living covertly.

uaud39WJ3SWa5LYJ.name: Rejuvenation
uaud39WJ3SWa5LYJ.description: When destroyed, 287's ghost re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} in her room at the Tsevel Center, fully healed. She can be only be permanently destroyed if her name is returned to her while conscious, or if the journal bearing her number is destroyed and its ashes are removed from the Tsevel Center.

KOkepJv6UR2jlgvX.name: Feed on the Living
KOkepJv6UR2jlgvX.description:
287's ghost touches a creature in reach. If the target is a living creature it takes damage from the ghost's ghostly hand with a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save. If the ghost is in their living visage, they can disguise Feed on the Living as a benign touch and delay the effects for 1 minute while keeping the target unaware of the effect. A creature can be affected by only one delayed Feed on the Living at a time, and if the ghost loses their living visage during that minute, the Feed on the Living is lost.

Critical Success The target's life energy overpowers the ghost. 287's ghost takes @Damage[5[vitality]] damage, and the target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage, and the ghost regains HP equal to the damage dealt.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and the ghost regains HP equal to the damage dealt.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 minute and the ghost regains HP equal to the damage dealt.

iSgL2MkhOw9CCxZy.name: Ravenous Undoing
iSgL2MkhOw9CCxZy.description: In each 24-hour period, 287's ghost must use Feed on the Living to consume 30 HP (any HP the ghost would gain count toward this total, even if the ghost has enough HP that they don't actually regain the full amount). If the ghost hasn't consumed enough HP, they mindlessly and recklessly feed on any living creature they come across until satiated.

eecScMTNBYvrcBWo.name: Telekinetic Assault
eecScMTNBYvrcBWo.description: The ghost cries out in pain and anguish as small objects and debris fly about in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. Creatures in this area take @Damage[3d6[bludgeoning]] damage, subject to a @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save.

Empowered Daeodon.name: Empowered Daeodon
Empowered Daeodon.description:
Where the typical boar is merely ill-tempered and generally unfriendly, the towering daeodon is legitimately hateful and ruthlessly violent. Although omnivorous, the daeodon prefers to feed on flesh. Primarily a scavenger, the daeodon isn't adverse to attacking creatures it encounters while searching for easier meals, or to protect any perceived encroachment into its lair or feeding grounds. Particularly brave or skilled orcs are fond of using daeodons as mounts or war-trained battle beasts; orc cavalry mounted on daeodons is a fearsome force indeed.

A typical adult daeodon is 10 feet long and 7 feet tall at the shoulder. It weighs approximately 2,000 pounds.

While domesticated pigs are a staple of farm life, wild boars are much more dangerous. Foul-tempered warthogs are relatively common, while the lumbering, primeval beasts known as daeodons are less so. Voracious eaters, boars can ravage the countryside in which they live. Boars breed freely, and a pair of boars can rapidly grow to a large family. Boars are a particular nuisance to farmers, as they break into food stores and root through gardens to sate their hunger.

TEn7gmE6LHEqbMLJ.name: Daeodon Charge
TEn7gmE6LHEqbMLJ.description: The daeodon Strides twice then makes a tusk Strike. As long as it moved at least 20 feet, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its attack roll. A Medium or smaller creature struck by this attack must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} by the force of the blow.

Vq7bB1WoqTjqLDVY.name: -2 Will Vs. Higher-Ranking Members of the Cult

xQq7iqAGhBjNlY5v.name: Frenzied Assault
xQq7iqAGhBjNlY5v.description: The Deskari fanatic Strides to an enemy creature and makes three Strikes in a frenzy. These Strikes have a +1 status bonus to attack and a +2 status bonus to damage. The Deskari fanatic can't make a frenzied assault on a creature it's already in melee with.

IHLllwlUCgomc8hX.name: Flee
IHLllwlUCgomc8hX.description:
Trigger The hermit rat's jar is destroyed

Effect The hermit rat Strides up to its Speed without triggering reactions.

7YWR4XkTyAFRJ184.name: Kimchi Jar Shell
7YWR4XkTyAFRJ184.description: The hermit rat's kimchi jar shell has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once hermit rat is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its kimchi jar shell breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 12.

Hn4ER7lWs29tdyTk.name: Ram
Hn4ER7lWs29tdyTk.description: The hermit rat rolls in its vessel up to its full movement, ramming into a target in its path and dealing @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save).

b0lQ8Ceyfl07FDwF.name: Toxic Gulp
b0lQ8Ceyfl07FDwF.description:
The toxic gator uses Swallow Whole on a creature of Medium size or smaller, @Damage[(2d6+5)[bludgeoning],1d6[poison]]{2d6+5 damage plus 1d6 poison}, Rupture 15

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

r6teXGTpnk5KmhOs.name: Wall Slam
r6teXGTpnk5KmhOs.description:
Requirements The toxic gator must have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The toxic gator flips its body, twisting its victim, then releases, flinging them into the nearest wall. It makes a jaws Strike with a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll against the grabbed creature. If it hits, it also does @Damage[(2d6+8)[bludgeoning]] damage and knocks the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If it fails, it releases the creature.

pVbB1gSZAFJU6rqe.name: Vulkariki Athletics
pVbB1gSZAFJU6rqe.description: A vulkariki eidolon can use Acrobatics instead of Athletics on checks normally requiring Athletics.

bvx1dx28ijDBiYhD.name: Vulkariki Tricks
bvx1dx28ijDBiYhD.description: A vulkariki eidolon can use Acrobatics instead of Thievery to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ijZ0DDFpMkWqaShd]{Palm an Object} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal}.

tmzjCUUMHKEmtqEy.name: Living Visage
tmzjCUUMHKEmtqEy.description: While she has more than 30 HP, 287's appears to be a living creature. She has an automatic result of 34 on Deception checks and DCs to conceal her undead status and can Feed on the Living covertly.

uaud39WJ3SWa5LYJ.description: When destroyed, 287's ghost re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} in her room at the Tsevel Center, fully healed. She can be only be permanently destroyed if her name is returned to her while conscious, or if the journal bearing her number is destroyed and its ashes are removed from the Tsevel Center.
